text: * About the author About the author{{{1 ## About the author.
Name: Book 15

text: Steven Konkoly graduated from the United States Naval Academy and served for eight years in various roles within the Navy and Marine Corps.
Name: Book 15

text: He currently lives with his family in southern Maine, where he works for a major pharmaceutical company.
Name: Book 15

text: He published his first novel,   The Jakarta Pandemic   , in 2010, followed by four book in the   Black Flagged   series   : Black Flagged Redux   (2012),   Black Flagged Apex   (2012),   Black Flagged Vektor   (2013).
Name: Book 15

text: He recently (Dec 2013) launched the   Perseid Collapse   , book one in an epic post-apocalyptic series featuring characters from   The Jakarta Pandemic  .
Name: Book 15

text: An excerpt from this apocalyptic thriller can be found at the end of this book, along with an excerpt from the next book in his   Black Flagged   series,   Black Flagged Redux.
Name: Book 15

text: * Acknowledgments Acknowledgments{{{1 ## Acknowledgments.
Name: Book 15

text: I now see that the acknowledgments will grow with each novel, which is a good thing.
Name: Book 15

text: First, let me start out with the all of the readers that voiced support for my first novel, The Jakarta Pandemic.
Name: Book 15

text: Your encouragement and interaction has been genuinely appreciated over the past year, and I encourage readers of Black Flagged to reach out with the same enthusiasm.
Name: Book 15

text: So, here we go.
Name: Book 15

text: To my wife, the first reader, who devoured the novel without taking a break.
Name: Book 15

text: I figured this was a good sign, especially since this is not her typical genre.
Name: Book 15

text: She actually beat me to the end and demanded that I finish the last few chapters.
Name: Book 15

text: If you don't like the ending, you can blame her for rushing me.
Name: Book 15

text: To my writing group, who warmly welcomed me into their world and endured Black Flagged's opening chapter violence way better than I expected.
Name: Book 15

text: After reading several other submissions within the group, I thought I might need to tone down my material for our gatherings.
Name: Book 15

text: I couldn't have been more mistaken.
Name: Book 15

text: I've gained valuable insight about my own book and have been exposed to the talents of new writers in a wide spectrum of genres.
Name: Book 15

text: Joe, thank you for introducing me to this groupand for your continuous critiques and suggestions throughout the process of writing both books.
Name: Book 15

text: To my pre-readersmost of whom volunteered, some of whom I didn't know before writing The Jakarta Pandemic.
Name: Book 15

text: Bill, for the valuable guidance regarding the structure of the entire series, and for some spot on advice about Daniel Petrovich, Black Flagged's main character; Trent, for once again going above and beyond the call of duty.
Name: Book 15

text: I couldn't ask for morea marked up manuscript and plot pacing suggestions for the book's big twist.
Name: Book 15

text: As a D.
Name: Book 15

text: resident, he also helped me to structure some of the local scenes.
Name: Book 15

text: Joe H.
Name: Book 15

text: , who probably made my editor's life easier.
Name: Book 15

text: Based on his straightforward critique of my last novel, and his frequent interaction among reviewers of The Jakarta Pandemic, I didn't hesitate to take him up on his offer to pre-read Black Flagged.
Name: Book 15

text: His "right between the eyes" style of critique has been essential to the fine tuning of several aspects, and his ability to take in the bigger picturewhile still catching typos and grammar errors is enviable.
Name: Book 15

text: Finally, Bruce, for catching some really elusive typos and keeping the Portland references accurate.
Name: Book 15

text: To Felicia A.
Name: Book 15

text: Sullivan, editor extraordinaire.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll just thank you in advance for the professionalism you put into expertly editing Black Flagged, and the enthusiasm you'll bring to promoting it.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: I still can't thank you enough for the extra mile you walked for The Jakarta Pandemic.
Name: Book 15

text: At some point, we'll collaborate within your favorite genre to create the ultimate post-apocalyptic novel.
Name: Book 15

text: It'll rock the genre, I guarantee.
Name: Book 15

text: Finally, to Jeroen ten Berge, for knocking it out of the park with his cover design.
Name: Book 15

text: He really captured the essence of Black Flagged with his bold vision.
Name: Book 15

text: * Dedication Dedication{{{1 ## Dedication.
Name: Book 15

text: To my wife and children, who are my constant motivation, and graciously put up with the time and energy that I devote to writing.
Name: Book 15

text: * Cast of Characters Cast of Characters{{{1 ## Cast of Characters.
Name: Book 15

text: Srecko Hadzic   \- Leader of the "Panthers," a quasi-organized crime network and Serbian ultra-nationalist paramilitary group serving Slobodan Milosevic's regime.
Name: Book 15

text: Pavle Hadzic   \- Hadzic's handicapped brother.
Name: Book 15

text: Radovan Grahovac   \- Hadzic's "right-hand" man and chief-of-security.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko Resja (aka Daniel Petrovich)   \- Midlevel soldier and undercover U.
Name: Book 15

text: operative.
Name: Book 15

text: Mirko Jovic   \- Leader of "White Eagles," a rival paramilitary group.
Name: Book 15

text: Goran Lujic   \- "White Eagles" enforcer.
Name: Book 15

text: Director   \- Benjamin Shelby.
Name: Book 15

text: Executive Assistant Director Fred Carroll \- National Security Branch.
Name: Book 15

text: Associate Director Sandra Delgado \- National Security Branch.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent-in-Charge Ryan Sharpe   \- Task Force HYRDA's investigative leader.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Frank Mendoza   \- Sharpe's second in command.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Heather Olson   \- Primary investigator, HYDRA murders.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Dana O'Reilly   \- Lead data analyst, HYDRA.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Justin Edwards   \- Lead investigator for Mohammed Ghani murder scene.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Keith Weber   \- Communications section-head, HYDRA.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Gregory Carlisle   \- Lead Interrogator, HYDRA murders.
Name: Book 15

text: Audra Bauer   \- Director, Counterterrorism Center, National Clandestine Service.
Name: Book 15

text: Karl Berg   \- Assistant director, Counterterrorism Center, National Clandestine Service.
Name: Book 15

text: Randy Keller   \- CIA liaison to Task Force HYDRA.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel Petrovich   \- Former Black Flag operative.
Name: Book 15

text: General Terrence Sanderson   \- Created original Black Flag program.
Name: Book 15

text: James Parker   \- Sanderson's "right-hand" man.

text: Jeffrey Munoz   \- Suspect in the shooting of Umar Salah.

Name: Book 15

text: * BLACK OUT BLACK OUT{{{1 ## BLACK OUT.
Name: Book 15

text: A few miles outside of Vizic, Serbia.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko Resja peered cautiously over the top of the jagged stone wall, scanning the lodge's distant front porch with powerful binoculars.
Name: Book 15

text: Through the driving downpour, he counted four men, which was a good thing.
Name: Book 15

text: With the entire external security team in one place, he should have no trouble approaching unseen.
Name: Book 15

text: He lowered himself to the spongy, pine-needle-covered ground and leaned back against a sharp granite chunk that formed part of the estate's perimeter wall.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Created by haphazardly dumping large uneven rocks around the lodge on all sides, the utilitarian border marked the divide between hastily cleared land and the impenetrable Fruska Gora National Forest.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko had arrived at the stone wall one hour earlier, hampered by the same relentless rainfall that had kept NATO aircraft at bay for more than a week.
Name: Book 15

text: Concealed in the dense pine foliage behind the jagged barrier, he could hear the distant roar of high-altitude jets through the unremitting storm.
Name: Book 15

text: He guessed the NATO pilots were testing Belgrade's air defense network from a safe distance, impatient for the weather to clear over the northern Balkan Peninsula.
Name: Book 15

text: He stared out into the wavering pine forest before turning his attention back to the lodge.
Name: Book 15

text: The two-story, modern, stone and beam structure looked sturdy enough to withstand an artillery attack.
Name: Book 15

text: A similarly constructed, one-story garage stood between him and the house, partially obscuring his view of the main structure.
Name: Book 15

text: Srecko Hadzic, ruthless leader of the paramilitary Serbian Panther crime syndicate, had built the lodge for the sole purpose of hiding his brother, Pavle, from prying eyes.
Name: Book 15

text: Rumors of NATO commando teams operating within Serbian borders had taken root among upper-level leadership, raising paranoia to near panic levels, and Hadzic feared Pavle's capture more than his own at this point.
Name: Book 15

text: Unfortunately for Hadzic, the Vizic compound was one of the worst- kept secrets in Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: He took one more look over the top of the wall, just to make sure all four men were still on the porch.
Name: Book 15

text: He spotted the bright orange glow of cigarettes through the nearly impenetrable rain squall.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't expect any of them to emerge from their cozy shelter, but he had to keep in mind that these men were all current or former Serbian Special Operations types, and despite the overindulgences often associated with paramilitary security details, all of these men had been hand-picked for their competence.
Name: Book 15

text: Three more had accompanied Radovan Grahovac, Hadzic's chief of security, into the lodge to meet with Pavle.
Name: Book 15

text: They had all arrived dressed in civilian clothes, which suggested that the crew might head north for a night of prostitutes and drinking along the banks of the Danube River in Novi Sad.
Name: Book 15

text: Despite their casual dress, however, each man carried a compact assault rifle and a pistol.
Name: Book 15

text: Under normal circumstances, this was not a crew he would fuck with.
Name: Book 15

text: Today, Marko would make a notable exception.
Name: Book 15

text: Satisfied that all four men were still in the same place, he picked up a long, thick, black nylon duffel bag and ran to a position along the wall that was completely obscured from the porch by the garage.
Name: Book 15

text: He knew from two previous reconnaissance trips that Radovan didn't stay more than ten minutes, which meant he was already running out of time.
Name: Book 15

text: From his new vantage point, he glanced over the wall and saw one of two dark blue Range Rovers that had arrived at Pavle's hideaway a few minutes ago, depositing Radovan and his heavily-armed security detail.
Name: Book 15

text: The other Range Rover was parked several meters behind the first, hidden from his view by the garage.
Name: Book 15

text: He kneeled low and wrestled a Serbian-made light machine gun out of the soaked nylon bag, extending the weapon's foldable shoulder stock.
Name: Book 15

text: He placed the weapon against the wall and reached back into the bag for one of two detachable ammunition drums.
Name: Book 15

text: He swiftly attached one of the seventy-five-round drums to the weapon and placed the second in a hip satchel.
Name: Book 15

text: Beyond the high-capacity ammunition drums, he had four standard thirty-round magazines velcroed into quick-access pouches on his combat vest, nestled among four stun grenades.
Name: Book 15

text: He screwed a large suppressor to the machine gun's barrel and chambered a round with the weapon's charging lever.
Name: Book 15

text: The final item he took from the bag was a gray, aluminum, ice-climbing axe, which he attached low on the side of his vest.
Name: Book 15

text: He gripped the sturdy assault weapon with his left hand and hopped over the rock wall, using his right hand for leverage.
Name: Book 15

text: After splashing down in ankle- high mud, he slogged through the torrential rain to reach the left back corner of the garage.
Name: Book 15

text: From that spot, he'd be able to see the four men leave the porch, which was critical to his plan.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko arrived at the corner, careful not to expose himself.
Name: Book 15

text: He checked all of his gear one more time, wishing he could check the computer and satellite phone in his waterproof backpack, but just as quickly dismissing the idea as last minute paranoia.
Name: Book 15

text: He knew the electronics rig worked, and that it would give him a secure satellite connection for both the satellite phone and his computer.
Name: Book 15

text: He had assembled and tested it nearly a dozen times within the last twenty-four hours.
Name: Book 15

text: He might not even need it, but he wasn't about to take any chances, and neither was General Sanderson.
Name: Book 15

text: The rain intensified for a minute, as sheets of water pummeled the side of the garage.
Name: Book 15

text: Despite having been exposed to the frigid early spring rain for nearly two hours, he wasn't cold.
Name: Book 15

text: Under his paramilitary camouflage outfit, he wore a waterproof, insulated, one-piece jumpsuit.
Name: Book 15

text: Certainly not standard issue for elite Serbian commandos, or even the most pampered members of Hadzic's paramilitary forces.
Name: Book 15

text: Nothing in Marko's equipment load-out was standard Serbian issue, which distressed him.
Name: Book 15

text: As an American deep-cover operative, he hadn't fired or handled a weapon less than twenty years old since his arrival in Serbia two years ago.
Name: Book 15

text: The model he held in his hand came fresh off the Zastava Arms assembly line, compliments of General Sanderson, but it felt alien to him.
Name: Book 15

text: Instinctively, he knew everything he carried was superior to the ancient hardware handed down to him by senior members of the Panthers, who passed their equipment down to make room for newer toys.
Name: Book 15

text: Still, it felt strangely uncomfortable.
Name: Book 15

text: He peeked around the corner of the garage and saw one of the men throw a lit cigarette out into the front yard.
Name: Book 15

text: Another man talked excitedly into a small handheld radio and rapidly nodded his head.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko released the weapon's safety and pulled a rain-soaked black ski mask down over his head.
Name: Book 15

text: He peered cautiously around the corner, watching the men scramble off the porch.
Name: Book 15

text: When they vanished from his sight, he moved rapidly down the unobserved side of the garage to the front corner and risked another peek.
Name: Book 15

text: Everything looked just like he had expected.
Name: Book 15

text: The lead SUV was already loaded with Radovan and the three men who had accompanied him inside the lodge.
Name: Book 15

text: The four commandos from the porch jogged toward the rear SUV.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd witnessed the same scene several dozen times before.
Name: Book 15

text: Radovan always insisted that the team assigned to the rear vehicle wait for all of the members of the lead car to get situated.
Name: Book 15

text: When he'd first seen this, he thought it might be for security reasons, but he'd learned firsthand that this was simply another one of Radovan's psychotic quirks.
Name: Book 15

text: He also knew that all four members of the rear security team, anxious to get out of the rain, would be so preoccupied watching the lead SUV that he could engage them completely undetected.
Name: Book 15

text: He pushed these thoughts aside and instantly engaged a near trance-like mindset.
Name: Book 15

text: He stepped out into the open and lowered his body into a semi-crouch, aiming at the last man in the group.
Name: Book 15

text: Through the Aimpoint sight, he placed the red dot on the man's upper back, just below the nape of his neck, and squeezed the trigger for a short burst.
Name: Book 15

text: The weapon kicked considerably, but he kept it under control and repeated the process for the remaining three guards.
Name: Book 15

text: He sprinted for the back of the empty SUV and reached it before the last guard hit the ground.
Name: Book 15

text: None of them had a chance to react.
Name: Book 15

text: If anything, a couple of them might have felt a warm, chunky spray.
Name: Book 15

text: Less than five seconds had elapsed.
Name: Book 15

text: A quick glance back confirmed that all four members of Radovan's rear security team were dead, and Marko moved forward along the right side of the rear SUV, focused on Radovan's vehicle.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Radovan sat impatiently in the front passenger seat of his Range Rover, listening to the rain hammering the truck's thick metal roof.
Name: Book 15

text: He hated these trips and absolutely despised handing their hard-earned cash over to Hadzic's "gang-banger worshiping" brother, Pavle.
Name: Book 15

text: Radovan was a committed ultra- nationalist and had no tolerance for the newly arrived American "gangsta" music that had penetrated the Belgrade club scene.
Name: Book 15

text: When Radovan hit the town, which he frequently did, Belgrade went hip-hop free.
Name: Book 15

text: Nobody risked incurring the security chief's wrath.
Name: Book 15

text: "Why the fuck are we not out of here already.
Name: Book 15

text: he yelled at the rain-blurred windshield.
Name: Book 15

text: Directly behind him, one of the commandos shifted uncomfortably.
Name: Book 15

text: Here we go again.
Name: Book 15

text: He turned his head back over his right shoulder, equally annoyed with his infantile boss and the idiots in the other Range Rover.
Name: Book 15

text: Through the wide back window of the Range Rover's gate, he noted a figure sliding down the right side of the rear SUV, but never had a chance to form much more of an impression about the situation.
Name: Book 15

text: Several steel-jacketed bullets ripped through his skull, initiating chaos within the SUV.
Name: Book 15

text: Radovan was immediately hit by two of the bullets that passed unhindered through the commando's throat.
Name: Book 15

text: One struck him in the upper left shoulder, where it stayed, and the other ricocheted off the metal headrest post and grazed the right side of his neck.
Name: Book 15

text: The windshield in front of Radovan crumbled, and he instinctively grabbed for the short-barreled assault rifle that rested between his right leg and the door.
Name: Book 15

text: Before his hand completed the twelve-inch journey, the front passenger door erupted in a fusillade of torn plastic, metal fragments, and safety glass.
Name: Book 15

text: His hand never touched the rifle.
Name: Book 15

text: He felt incredible surges of pain at multiple points throughout his body, vaguely aware that a figure moved across the front of the SUV, firing continuously into the vehicle.
Name: Book 15

text: His head snapped violently backward and to the left, leaving him with a view of a shattered body in the seat behind the driver.
Name: Book 15

text: He tried to call out to the man, but couldn't form the words.
Name: Book 15

text: He watched as a dark red stain splattered the bodyguard's window, and a red mist aerosolized the rear cargo compartment.
Name: Book 15

text: This was the last thing Radovan would ever see.
Name: Book 15

text: Against all odds, the driver, Jorji, survived the seemingly endless hail of bullets.
Name: Book 15

text: He was hit several times, but knew that he was not critically wounded.
Name: Book 15

text: When the first bullets passed through the car, Jorji twisted his body to the right, pressing down on the center console, trying to present the lowest possible target to his attackers.
Name: Book 15

text: This was not the first time he had been attacked in a vehicle, and his previous experience kept him alive a little longer than the rest of the Range Rover's occupants.
Name: Book 15

text: Several bullets pierced the back of his seat and tore into the top left side of his body, causing mostly superficial damage, but shredding muscle and tendon from his left hip all the way up to his shoulder.
Name: Book 15

text: The extensive muscle damage along his entire left side kept him locked in place over the center console, with his face nearly buried in Radovan's lap.
Name: Book 15

text: No matter how hard he tried, he could not sit up, which was another reason that he was still alive.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko dropped to the soaked gravel near the front left tire of the Range Rover and rolled over onto his left side, which gave him easy access to the hip satchel containing the second ammunition drum.
Name: Book 15

text: The gun's barrel sizzled as the rain struck the dangerously overheated metal.
Name: Book 15

text: A hundred thoughts and stimuli flashed through his brain, which were immediately prioritized and processed for his use.
Name: Book 15

text: His trance reduced useless distractions like emotion, hesitation or fear, and enhanced his focus on the highly-specialized skills required to survive.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale
Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: "Reload weapon" was at the very top of the list.
Name: Book 15

text: His weapon wasn't empty, but he knew that seventy-five rounds didn't last very long at the rate he had fired.
Name: Book 15

text: In the flash of a synapse, "driver still alive" was also broadcasted, and his eyes narrowed.
Name: Book 15

text: He had fired long bursts into each passenger as he moved counterclockwise around the SUV.
Name: Book 15

text: After targeting the rear right guard and Radovan, he fired a lengthy burst at the driver through the rear right door window.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko knew the bullets had passed through the seat and connected with the driver, but the man's demise was not conclusive, and he knew it.
Name: Book 15

text: He detached the drum magazine and threw it out of the way.
Name: Book 15

text: The second drum was out of the satchel and attached to the light machine gun in a blur of his hands.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko raised his body into a low crouch, keeping well below the window, and fired a sustained burst through the center of the front driver door.
Name: Book 15

text: The silence felt like an eternity to Jorji, but he knew his lifespan was now measured in seconds unless he could take the offensive.
Name: Book 15

text: Jorji lifted his head up far enough out of Radovan's blood-soaked lap to catch sight of the assault rifle jammed against the door by Radovan's leg.
Name: Book 15

text: Jorji knew this was his only hope.
Name: Book 15

text: His only weapon, a small semi-automatic pistol, was jammed under his right armpit in a concealed holster, and he couldn't lift his body to free it.
Name: Book 15

text: Not that it would have mattered if he could.
Name: Book 15

text: Jorji was left handed, and a bullet had passed through the back of his left elbow, rendering his arm useless.
Name: Book 15

text: He strained to slide his right arm free, and his hand managed to reach the rifle just as several bullets punctured the driver door and put an end to any hope that he might survive.
Name: Book 15

text: Keeping the machine gun aimed forward, he peered into the SUV and saw the driver leaned over Radovan's lap.
Name: Book 15

text: The man was shredded, but his death was still far from conclusive.
Name: Book 15

text: Through his weapon's sight, he centered the red dot on the back of the man's skull.
Name: Book 15

text: One quick trigger removed any doubt that Radovan's security team was finished.
Name: Book 15

text: He pulled back up against the house and absorbed the entire scene.
Name: Book 15

text: The carnage resembled a well-executed ambush, and there was little chance that anyone would suspect the attack was perpetrated by one person.
Name: Book 15

text: The vehicle was shredded on all sides by bullets, and most of the safety glass lay shattered on the packed gravel.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd fired from nearly every angle around the car, leaving shell casings scattered everywhere.
Name: Book 15

text: He saw that two of the guards behind the rear SUV had fallen on top of each other and immediately decided that he'd stuff one of them into the trunk of the luxury Mercedes in the garage.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd dump the car into one of the lakes near Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: The absence of a junior member of Radovan's inner sanctum would lead Hadzic to suspect that this was an inside job, and if anyone took a close look at the ground around the bodies, they would only find the washed-out evidence of three deaths.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko decided to skip any further house surveillance and moved toward the door.
Name: Book 15

text: He had done a mixed job of keeping the noise level down and didn't want to waste any time if Pavle's bodyguards had been alerted.
Name: Book 15

text: The suppressor had performed as advertised, ensuring that the automatic weapon would not draw anyone's attention over the rainstorm, but the Range Rover was a different story.
Name: Book 15

text: He was not at all satisfied with the noise created by the bullets that struck the SUV's heavy steel frame.
Name: Book 15

text: To Marko, it had sounded like multiple, low speed fender benders.
Name: Book 15

text: He would have to move quickly.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: He reached his right hand over to the doorknob and tried to twist it.
Name: Book 15

text: Wasting no time, he reached into his hip satchel and removed an object that resembled a small plastic explosive charge.
Name: Book 15

text: He tightly jammed it between the doorknob and door trim.
Name: Book 15

text: He pulled a small plastic device out of a pouch on his vest and slid it upward along the door from the first small charge.
Name: Book 15

text: The device's LED turned green about two feet above the doorknob.
Name: Book 15

text: He placed a second charge against the trim, where the LED flashed green.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko pulled a small cotter pin on each of the homemade devices and pressed himself flush against the paved stone wall of the lodge.
Name: Book 15

text: In rapid succession, each device ignited and burned intensely for five seconds.
Name: Book 15

text: The thermite packages created very little noise, but generated an incredible amount of smoke, usually on both sides of the door.
Name: Book 15

text: He pushed firmly on the heavy oak door, which gave way now that the locks had been melted.
Name: Book 15

text: He held his breath and stepped into the house.
Name: Book 15

text: The caustic smoke obscured his vision and burned his eyes momentarily, but he immediately recognized that he was on a small landing.
Name: Book 15

text: Several stairs led up into the house through an enclosed stairwell that separated the landing from the main house and kept him out of sight.
Name: Book 15

text: His ears picked up a familiar sound, which relieved him of any fears that his attack had been compromised.
Name: Book 15

text: A hardcore rap song vibrated throughout the lodge.
Name: Book 15

text: His mouth formed a thin grin as a Serbian-accented "yeah, motherfucka" echoed alongside the lyrics.
Name: Book 15

text: He eased up the stairs and peeked around the corner.
Name: Book 15

text: The lodge's ground floor was an open concept space, which gave him a clear view straight through the kitchen, into the great room.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko didn't see any smoke detectors in the kitchen, which allowed him to relax the pace slightly.
Name: Book 15

text: The ceiling opened up just past the eat-in kitchen area to form a two-story great room, with floor to ceiling windows on the far wall facing Marko.
Name: Book 15

text: A dark gray slate fireplace and chimney split the middle of this wall and disappeared into the timber-framed ceiling.
Name: Book 15

text: The men were stationed around a rustic, dark wooden coffee table, which was centered on the fireplace and littered with a pile of mixed currency.
Name: Book 15

text: A dimly-lit chandelier hung low over the coffee table, attached to the ceiling by a thick, black chain.
Name: Book 15

text: He spotted Pavle immediately, which was not a difficult task.
Name: Book 15

text: Pavle was paralyzed from the waist down and confined to a wheelchair, which faced the fireplace.
Name: Book 15

text: Both of Pavle's outstretched arms embraced the deep hip-hop beat with a slow, synchronized wave.
Name: Book 15

text: Each hand held a thick stack of American bills.
Name: Book 15

text: He assessed the bodyguards.
Name: Book 15

text: A large, stocky man in a black turtleneck sweater and brown jacket stood in front of Pavle, bouncing up and down completely out of rhythm.
Name: Book 15

text: The second bodyguard sat on a dark, rich leather couch to the left of the table, nodding his head to the steady rhythm and rolling what Marko assumed to be a marijuana joint.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Five Chapter Five{{{1 ### Chapter Five.
Name: Book 15

text: CIA Headquarters, McLean, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: Randy Keller strode casually down a crowded corridor in the National Clandestine Service's wing of the Central Intelligence Agency's headquarters building.
Name: Book 15

text: At seven in the morning, the Counterterrorism Center's section was quiet; most of the analysts and staff were sitting in sluggish traffic, still thirty to sixty minutes away from the CIA's sprawling McLean, Virginia, campus.
Name: Book 15

text: In about thirty minutes, the place was going to explode, and he would prefer to be back on the road when it did.
Name: Book 15

text: He just needed to get the required "face-to-face" check-in out of the way, then he would be free to cruise back to his liaison office at FBI headquarters, where he imagined he would be sleeping for the next week, until they figured out exactly what had happened to Task Force HYDRA.
Name: Book 15

text: He reached the end of the corridor and paused at a door that read "Karl Berg, Assistant Director, Counterterrorism.
Name: Book 15

text: He knocked and waited.
Name: Book 15

text: "Come in," he heard someone yell.
Name: Book 15

text: He scanned the room as he stepped inside and was surprised to find both Karl Berg and Audra Bauer, director of the Counterterrorism Center, sitting around a small spare computer workstation next to Berg's desk.
Name: Book 15

text: They both glanced at him as he hesitantly entered.
Name: Book 15

text: He hadn't expected to make a report directly to the CTC's director.
Name: Book 15

text: "Grab a seat, Randy.
Name: Book 15

text: The director and I just finished with the latest feed from the FBI.
Name: Book 15

text: This link is fantastic work.
Name: Book 15

text: You're seeing what they feed out to their on-scene agents and key section heads.
Name: Book 15

text: They add agents to the feed as they are brought into the investigation.
Name: Book 15

text: It keeps everyone in the loop and on the same page, but it's not always the fullest picture," he said.
Name: Book 15

text: "And that's exactly why we have you over there.
Name: Book 15

text: I've read your summaries of this morning's events.
Name: Book 15

text: I agree that the FBI had been compromised.
Name: Book 15

text: Please have a seat," said Bauer.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller turned a chair to face them and sat down.
Name: Book 15

text: He glanced at the window and wondered if they were really designed to resist electronic listening devices.
Name: Book 15

text: In over fifteen years at the CIA, this had never been a concern for Keller, since he had never sat behind a desk in a room with a window.
Name: Book 15

text: His office at the FBI was the closest he'd ever achieved, located across the hall from the coveted window offices.
Name: Book 15

text: "Do you have any ideas about where to start looking.
Name: Book 15

text: "Ma'am, it's difficult to say.
Name: Book 15

text: They don't compartmentalize their operations like we do here.
Name: Book 15

text: This is one of their highest priority investigative task forces, but they still have no organic support assets.
Name: Book 15

text: The core team is permanently assigned to HYDRA and is comprised of mostly Terror Financing personnel, but they rely on key players in nearly every other section for critical, daily support.
Name: Book 15

text: These key personnel probably spend most of their time working for the task force, but they also support other investigations within the entire Counterterrorism Division.
Name: Book 15

text: I see new names and new faces on a weekly, if not daily basis.
Name: Book 15

text: I've managed to compile a list of everyone that I've seen, but I guarantee this is not a complete list.
Name: Book 15

text: Just too many people involved to count.
Name: Book 15

text: You should've seen how many people they assembled this morning.
Name: Book 15

text: Lots of fresh faces," he said and handed a flash drive over to Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: We'll start looking at financial records, communications trailsget the groundwork rolling on this.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll walk this over to Counter- Intel," said Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: "Take it to HUMINT, too.
Name: Book 15

text: They need to know what to start looking for immediately.
Name: Book 15

text: Have them look back at least one year.
Name: Book 15

text: I guarantee this has been in the works for months, if not years," said Bauer.
Name: Book 15

text: "No mention by Sharpe of a possible leak.
Name: Book 15

text: "Not to the groupor to me.
Name: Book 15

text: "That's not much of a surprise.
Name: Book 15

text: He doesn't completely trust you, and he needs the task force to focus on evidentiary procedure.
Name: Book 15

text: Any mention of a leak this early would undermine the investigation," said Bauer flatly, then added, "We need to let them focus on what they do well, while we start digging into all the possibilities.
Name: Book 15

text: They all nodded, and the director stood up.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg and Keller joined her.
Name: Book 15

text: "All right, I'm going to brief the deputy.
Name: Book 15

text: Keep me directly in the loop on everything.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm not sure what we'll get from our in-house FBI liaison.
Name: Book 15

text: He's back in D.
Name: Book 15

text: doing the same thing you're doing.
Name: Book 15

text: Randy, I need you to figure out a way to get us inside their interrogation efforts.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm tempted to send someone out to Boston," she said from the door.
Name: Book 15

text: "I don't think it will be necessary.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe made it clear that he wanted a live interrogation feed, and I don't plan to stray very far from Sharpe's side, unless something interesting pops up," said Keller.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't think Sharpe has thought this through all the way.
Name: Book 15

text: He's sending a special team up to Boston with special orders that may not play out too well over a live feed.
Name: Book 15

text: He'll shut it down pretty quickly if Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: Carlisle pushes the envelope," she said and left the room.
Name: Book 15

text: "Back to DC with you.
Name: Book 15

text: Good work on this.
Name: Book 15

text: Let me know what you need, and it's yours," said Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: "I think I'm going to need a cot for my office.
Name: Book 15

text: I can't imagine any upcoming scenario in which you sleep.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll see if we can get in on the feed from Boston.
Name: Book 15

text: One way or another," said Keller.
Name: Book 15

text: "Now that would be an epic score on your part.
Name: Book 15

text: "That's why you have me over in FBI land.
Name: Book 15

text: Make sure to grab whatever you need on the way out.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll call tech support as soon as you leave my office, which should be in a few seconds," said Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: "I'm gone," he said and closed the door behind him.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller weaved his way through the growing crowd of analysts, displaying a combination of strained smiles and harried expressions that effectively discouraged anyone from engaging his attention.
Name: Book 15

text: He reached the elevator bank unmolested and jabbed the down button several times.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed to get back to FBI headquarters before the Boston interrogation began.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Six Chapter Six{{{1 ### Chapter Six.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel stared intensely at the flat-screen monitor in his office.
Name: Book 15

text: His door was closed, and he hadn't been interrupted since he arrived at 7:45, nearly thirty minutes ago.
Name: Book 15

text: This came as no surprise, since everyone was busy poring over their reports and preparing their speeches.
Name: Book 15

text: The overseas marketing division had a meeting at 9:00, followed by a general marketing department meeting at 10:00.
Name: Book 15

text: It was that time of the month for mother Zenith.
Name: Book 15

text: Sitting in his cubicle, Daniel was extremely worried.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't like what he had uncovered on the internet.
Name: Book 15

text: A simple Google search yielded seven additional murders similar to the one in Cape Elizabeth.
Name: Book 15

text: Wealthy Muslims, all murdered last night.
Name: Book 15

text: Details were sketchy in most cases, almost as if they had been withheld.
Name: Book 15

text: In one case, the Google link was no longer active.
Name: Book 15

text: This story had been filed in the   Providence Journal   , and its tag line had piqued Daniel's interest the most:.
Name: Book 15

text: "In Newport, a prominent businessman was found shot to death on his patiolocal authorities report suspect in custody.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't like the idea of a suspect in custody.
Name: Book 15

text: He was pretty sure Sanderson wouldn't like it either.
Name: Book 15

text: He sifted through the favorites file again and examined the information.
Name: Book 15

text: "Muslim art trader slain outside of Mount Pleasant Home.
Name: Book 15

text: Apparent close range shooting".
Name: Book 15

text: "Couple killed in bizarre drive-by shooting, while walking at night in the Eastport subdivision of Annapolis.
Name: Book 15

text: Killings shock neighbors, who describe Sa'id and Adia Faris as generous, peaceful members of their small community.
Name: Book 15

text: No suspects in shooting".
Name: Book 15

text: "Jibran Nazir's body was found by his wife outside of the entrance gate to their Hampton estate.
Name: Book 15

text: The passenger side of Nazir's car was riddled with bullets, leaving him dead on the scene".
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel clicked the mouse button on the next link.
Name: Book 15

text: "The link you have requested is inactive or no longer exists.
Name: Book 15

text: Someone is shutting this down quick.
Name: Book 15

text: He quickly shuffled through two more links.
Name: Book 15

text: Two more shootings, one a break-in at a Rye waterfront townhouse, husband and wife murdered; another in the upper west side of Manhattan, doorman and Asim Shareef executed just inside the lobby of an exclusive apartment building.
Name: Book 15

text: Three out of the eight articles mentioned federal law enforcement involvement, which included the stabbing of Mohammed Ghani, on the driveway of his Shore Road residence in Cape Elizabeth, Maine.
Name: Book 15

text: He entered several different search strings for the murder that concerned him the most.
Name: Book 15

text: The murder in Newport, Rhode Island, had been erased from the public's eye, which was an unsettling development.
Name: Book 15

text: If the feds actually caught the killer, Daniel's life could unravel quickly.
Name: Book 15

text: He softly pounded the keyboard tray with a closed fist.
Name: Book 15

text: He should have known better than to take the assignment, but he got lazy.
Name: Book 15

text: He had enjoyed five great years with Jessica, finally settling into a "normal" life he could tolerate.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't take much pleasure in his job, but who did.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed the normalcy and dullness of a civilian routine to suppress the urges fostered by Sanderson's programming.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't want to start over again, so he took the job thinking that Sanderson would go away.
Name: Book 15

text: Maybe he should have refused and taken the hard route.
Name: Book 15

text: Vanish and rebuild with Jessica somewhere else.
Name: Book 15

text: Maybe it didn't matter.
Name: Book 15

text: It looked like either choice would have led to the same result.
Name: Book 15

text: Sanderson was up to something big, and it was about to swallow them whole.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel closed the internet browser and turned his attention to the files stacked up on his desk.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed to maintain appearances for at least a few more hours, despite how very little he now cared about Zenith's overseas emerging markets.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Seven Chapter Seven{{{1 ### Chapter Seven.
Name: Book 15

text: FBI Headquarters, Washington, D.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent-in-Charge Sharpe stared up at the plasma-screen monitors in the task force operations center.
Name: Book 15

text: The screens had changed very little over the course of the morning, and he was starting to feel despondent about the day's affairs.
Name: Book 15

text: Eight separate crime scenes, and Sharpe had very little to show for their investigative progress.
Name: Book 15

text: A few sets of partial footprints, scattered witness statements and a flurry of ballistics reports, which had so far told them nothing they couldn't determine with their own eyes.
Name: Book 15

text: The victims were either knifed, shot in the face with a pistol at close range, or shot in the head with a sniper rifle from a longer range.
Name: Book 15

text: It was pretty easy to tell the difference between the pistol and sniper kills; the pistol rounds left the heads intact.
Name: Book 15

text: "We don't have shit," he stated to Special Agent Mendoza, who had just entered the room with a stack of papers.

text: "We have one of the shooters," Mendoza said, joining Sharpe at the screens.
Name: Book 15

text: "And he hasn't said shit.
Name: Book 15

text: We don't even know who he is, and we still haven't found his car.
Name: Book 15

text: All we know about this guy is that he's pretty handy with a scoped Remington 700 rifle.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm not even sure that advanced interrogation techniques would be effective with this guy," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Have you forwarded the request.

text: Mendoza said in a weak tone that betrayed the fact that he knew the answer already.

text: He'll take the interrogation as far as he can without breaking the law.
Name: Book 15

text: After that, someone else will have to decide how to proceed.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm about to authorize Carlisle and Olson to suggest the possibility of a deal.
Name: Book 15

text: Based on the lack of evidence we pulled from the other crime scenes, I have a feeling he didn't expect this little side trip.
Name: Book 15

text: The mention of an immunity deal might soften him up a bit.
Name: Book 15

text: "It's all we have left at this point," Mendoza confirmed, placing the stack of papers on Sharpe's temporary workstation.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe nodded at the pile of papers.
Name: Book 15

text: "More personnel requisition forms.
Name: Book 15

text: This should be the last of them.
Name: Book 15

text: We now have most of the building working for us," he said, in hopes of eliciting a laugh, or at least a smile.
Name: Book 15

text: "We'll lose these agents just as quickly if we don't start to produce more than phantom footprints and muddled witness statements.
Name: Book 15

text: I need to make some calls from my office," he said, grabbing the stack of papers.
Name: Book 15

text: The calls would be placed to the lead investigative agents at each crime scene, and he would condense their verbal reports for his final call to his immediate superior within the Terror Financing Operations Section, Associate Director Sandra Delgado.
Name: Book 15

text: He imagined Agent Delgado would turn right around and call the Executive Assistant Director Fred Carroll, who had overall responsibility for the FBI's Counterterrorism Division.
Name: Book 15

text: On and on the calls would go, rising up the chain of command, until Sharpe started the cycle over again less than an hour later.
Name: Book 15

text: It was part of his job as special agent-in- charge of Task Force HYDRA.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Eight Chapter Eight{{{1 ### Chapter Eight.

text: Special Agent Justin Edwards stood several feet away from Mohammed Ghani's body, staring out at a multi-million-dollar view of the Atlantic Ocean.

text: Dark green shutters accented the white windowpanes, competing with the neatly-trimmed evergreen bushes reaching upward toward the bottom of the window trim.

text: Agent Olson reeled backward, as if Munoz had thrown a poisonous snake on the table.
Name: Book 15

text: He had somehow managed to free his hands from the handcuffs that had been secured behind his back to the chair.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Carlisle reacted swiftly, charging around the side of the table, but stopped as Munoz placed both hands on the top of his head.
Name: Book 15

text: Both agents moved backward from the table, weapons drawn and pointed at the suspect.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: "None of you have any idea what you're dealing with here.

text: "Keep your hands on your head.
Name: Book 15

text: Back away from the table and get on your knees.

text: The interrogation room door opened, and three more agents entered.
Name: Book 15

text: One of them held a Taser, the other two carried MP-5 submachine guns.
Name: Book 15

text: Five agents stood well outside of Munoz's lunge radius, aiming weapons in his direction.

text: One false move would erase Munoz from existence and eliminate any chance the FBI had to make sense of the day.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz had told them that a link existed between General Terrence Sanderson and today's events, and that he would trade information about Sanderson for full immunity.
Name: Book 15

text: Without more information, they couldn't move on Sanderson.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

text: And since the FBI still had no idea who had masterminded the string of murders, they needed every bit of help available.

text: Unfortunately, Munoz represented the only break in their investigation.

text: The Department of Justice, with the full backing of the White House, agreed with this assessment.

text: "Patch me through to my lawyer.

text: As soon as you get what you need, I walk out of the door.

text: If you fuck with me on this deal, they'll carry you out the back door with a tag on your big toe," he said and lowered his body to his knees.

text: Munoz closed his eyes as at least three agents descended on him with zip ties and handcuffs.

text: "Your information better be worth this deal.

text: This information is worth a thousand deals.

text: And just for the record, I wouldn't worry too much about my survivability on the streets.

text: * Chapter Fifteen Chapter Fifteen{{{1 ### Chapter Fifteen.
Name: Book 15

text: FBI Headquarters, Washington, D.
Name: Book 15

text: The noise inside of Task Force HYDRA's operations room could be heard fifty feet down the hallway in any direction.
Name: Book 15

text: The raucous din attracted the attention of agents unconnected to the day's events, and once one of these interlopers learned the true scope of events, they would all scurry back to the safety of their undisturbed operations or task forces.
Name: Book 15

text: Like a dying star, the Terrorist Financing Operations Section had imploded that morning, sending a dense, pulsing gravity throughout the building; a black hole that sucked agents in and wouldn't let them go.
Name: Book 15

text: Agents wishing to go home that night steered clear of the Counterterrorism Division that day.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent-in-Charge Sharpe listened intently to the silence on the phone.
Name: Book 15

text: He stood in front of the large display screen, staring at information assembled regarding Jeffrey Munoz.
Name: Book 15

text: There was nothing in his military service record or civilian records to suggest his possible involvement in today's fiasco.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz owned a successful chain of five coffee shops in Hartford, Connecticut, leaving the day-to-day operations of the entire business to one of the shop managers he had promoted two years ago.
Name: Book 15

text: Agents interviewed Stebbens and several other employees.
Name: Book 15

text: Their stories were the same.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz loved his work, spending most of his day and evenings in his coffee shops, chatting with patrons and trading stock futures on his laptop.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz was obsessed with beating the downtrodden stock market, and since he had delegated most of the grunt work to Stebbens, he was free to chase his interests.
Name: Book 15

text: Financials for The Toasted Bean were solid, and Stebbens confirmed that he and Munoz had just run the numbers for opening a new shop.
Name: Book 15

text: Nothing to suggest Munoz would drive over a hundred miles to put an armor-piercing bullet through Umar Salah's head.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe waited patiently for the associate executive assistant director for National Security to take the line.
Name: Book 15

text: The FBI's request to the Pentagon for access to the Black Flag files had been formally submitted over an hour ago, followed by a few high-level personal calls.
Name: Book 15

text: It was rumored that the director of the FBI would contact the secretary of defense personally to express the urgency of the situation.
Name: Book 15

text: The line suddenly went live.
Name: Book 15

text: "Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe, I have the executive director for you now," a male voice said, followed by a click.
Name: Book 15

text: He had expected to speak with the associate director, Sandra Delgado, who he knew on a personal level.
Name: Book 15

text: Delgado and Sharpe had attended The Academy at the same time, one class apart, and had stayed cordially in touch over the years.
Name: Book 15

text: Sandra and her husband had dined with Ryan and his wife several times over the past year.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe didn't know what to expect from the director, and he didn't like surprises.
Name: Book 15

text: "Ryan, its Fred Carroll.
Name: Book 15

text: Sorry to ambush you like this, but the situation has changed slightly, and Sandra will no longer be included in the communication chain between the Pentagon and the bureau.
Name: Book 15

text: "I hope nothing is wrong, sir," Sharpe risked.
Name: Book 15

text: "Nothing wrong with Agent Delgado.
Name: Book 15

text: Apparently, there is something very wrong with the Black Flag files.
Name: Book 15

text: We need to maintain a minimal chain of information custody with regard to Black Flag," Carroll said.
Name: Book 15

text: "So Munoz wasn't lying.
Name: Book 15

text: "Apparently not, and whatever is in those files is protected by the Department of Defense's strictest compartmentalized protocols.
Name: Book 15

text: The Pentagon has agreed to grant us limited access.
Name: Book 15

text: We will be allowed to use the information to unravel today's events and determine if an immediate threat to the U.
Name: Book 15

text: exists.
Name: Book 15

text: My assistant will pass the protocols to you immediately.
Name: Book 15

text: Don't mess around with this information.
Name: Book 15

text: The director himself convinced the White House that access to Black Flag was critical, but I have a feeling that the doors to this vault could slam shut at any time.
Name: Book 15

text: Black Flag is a ticking time bomb that nobody wants aired in public.
Name: Book 15

text: Contact me directly with updates.
Name: Book 15

text: Instructions for direct contact will be contained in an email you should have just received.
Name: Book 15

text: Let's get to the bottom of this ASAP, without pissing off the Pentagon.
Name: Book 15

text: I have the best agents working every angle of this case," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "If you need more than that, don't hesitate to ask," Executive Director Carroll said, and the line went dead.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe waved to Mendoza, who pushed his way through several agents huddled over a bank of computer screens in the middle of the operations center.
Name: Book 15

text: By the time he arrived a few seconds later, Sharpe had read the director's email.
Name: Book 15

text: "Frank, take two agents from Counterintelligence and report to the Information/Data bureau of the Pentagon.
Name: Book 15

text: Your point of contact there will be Colonel Richard Farrington.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll need you there long enough to thoroughly assess pertinent information in the Black Flag files.
Name: Book 15

text: From what I've been told, the files are explosive and could be yanked out from under us without warning.
Name: Book 15

text: Focus on information regarding Black Flag personnel.
Name: Book 15

text: "Munoz lived close enough to his assigned target to imply a geographic-based assignment, so let's get names and start mapping out last known locations of all Black Flag operatives.
Name: Book 15

text: We might find a trend.
Name: Book 15

text: If we can nab another one of these murderers, we'll have our best chance at nailing this to the wall by the end of the day.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't know what kind of information they will be willing to release, but I'd like to know about capabilities.
Name: Book 15

text: If we need to take one of these guys down, I want to know exactly what kind of training they received.

text: We need to know what we're up against.

text: "All right, I'm on it.

text: Does Counterintel know I'm coming to grab more of their talent.
Name: Book 15

text: "They will in a few moments.
Name: Book 15

text: And, Frank, you and the two agents will have to sign Category One, Compartmentalized Information Security agreements prior to viewing any of the Black Flag documents.
Name: Book 15

text: Any agents who have even heard the words Black Flag will be required to sign a Category Two," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: We better get word to Boston.
Name: Book 15

text: The fewer agents exposed to this the better," Mendoza said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Once you arrive at the Pentagon, you will see a list of approved Category One personnel.

text: You are entitled to share any information you see with these individuals personally on a face-to-face contact basis.
Name: Book 15

text: That should be a very short list.
Name: Book 15

text: Myself, the two counterintelligence agents and Executive Assistant Director Carroll.
Name: Book 15

text: I expect that you'll be running back and forth all day to report to me.

text: The two agents will be required to stay inside the Sanctum during the active investigation or until the Pentagon shuts us down.
Name: Book 15

text: Let's nail this down quickly, Frank.
Name: Book 15

text: "We'll be thorough and get everything we need as quickly as possible," Frank assured him, exhaling deeply.
Name: Book 15

text: "The Pentagon will approve and classify all information to be shared, so be aggressive and fight for anything that might help us figure out what happened today.
Name: Book 15

text: They have a protocol for this.
Name: Book 15

text: Start with the names.
Name: Book 15

text: I think this is our best starting point.

text: Remember, you can share anything with me personally, but if it's not approved by the Pentagon, it's not going onto these screens.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Sixteen Chapter Sixteen{{{1 ### Chapter Sixteen.
Name: Book 15

text: The Pentagon, Arlington, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: Colonel Farrington saw the group approaching from the direction of the Information Section's only access point: four men, escorted by a navy lieutenant commander wearing the summer white uniform.
Name: Book 15

text: The navy had recently shifted uniforms, trading service dress blues, which resembled a dark blue suit, for a white, short-sleeved uniform that reminded Farrington of the old fashioned Good Humor Ice Cream man.
Name: Book 15

text: "Thank you, Commander, I have them from here.
Name: Book 15

text: Gentlemen, welcome to the Compartmentalized Information Section.
Name: Book 15

text: Let's take a seat in the briefing room and get the formalities out of the way so you can go to work," he said and led them to a room adjacent to his cubicle.
Name: Book 15

text: He fished a pair of keys out of the front right pocket of his crisply pressed dark green uniform trousers and opened both of the locks to the room.
Name: Book 15

text: The briefing room was sparse, decorated with a heavily varnished, rectangular conference table that could seat twelve.
Name: Book 15

text: However, there were no chairs in the room.
Name: Book 15

text: No pictures adorned the ugly off-white walls, and the room was illuminated by harsh fluorescent lights recessed behind large opaque plastic ceiling tiles.
Name: Book 15

text: Separate stacks of paperwork sat neatly arranged on each long side of the table.
Name: Book 15

text: Each stack was topped with a face sheet that displayed one of the agents' names.
Name: Book 15

text: Colonel Farrington walked to the far end of the table, as everyone else filled in by their respective stack.
Name: Book 15

text: Before anyone uttered a word, three more people filed into the room and stood against the wall facing the colonel, on the other side of the room.
Name: Book 15

text: The last one in, a female marine staff sergeant, closed the door behind her.
Name: Book 15

text: Farrington registered a look of discomfort on one of the FBI agent's faces when the door closed, which gave the colonel some satisfaction.
Name: Book 15

text: When he had arrived to take this post, he had replaced a navy captain, who had turned this conference room into his own personal oasis.
Name: Book 15

text: Comfortable chairs, pleasant lighting from several dimmable standing lamps, wall hangings and a fully stocked coffee station.
Name: Book 15

text: Other staff members assigned to the section used it as a lounge when it was not in use.
Name: Book 15

text: One of his first acts was to strip the room bare.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't want any sense of comfort to exist here.
Name: Book 15

text: In fact, he preferred that the room made everyone feel on edge.
Name: Book 15

text: Only clear plastic sheets covering the walls and floor would make him happier about the room.
Name: Book 15

text: His job was to enforce the Department of Defense's strictest information-sharing protocols.
Name: Book 15

text: Penalties for leaking information in the Sanctum ranged from a simple career-damaging letter of censure to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole on charges of treason.
Name: Book 15

text: He liked to set the right tone here in this room.
Name: Book 15

text: Nobody in his section even glanced twice at the door anymore, and he alone held the keys to open it.
Name: Book 15

text: "All right, let's get started.
Name: Book 15

text: There are four documents that each of you must sign to enter the Sanctum.
Name: Book 15

text: First, an explanation of the CIS categories and specific instructions regarding the management of sensitive information under each category.
Name: Book 15

text: CIS stands for Compartmentalized Information Security.
Name: Book 15

text: You will all need to read and sign the acknowledgement under CIS Category One, which I'm sure you are all aware, is the highest level of information security, carrying the highest levels of penalty for any accidental or purposeful unauthorized breach.
Name: Book 15

text: Category One is the easiest to remember.
Name: Book 15

text: You can only share information directly, and in person, with the individuals listed on your agreement.
Name: Book 15

text: In person means actually in person, face-to-face in a secure environment, taking all reasonable precautions from eavesdropping, purposeful or accidental.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Mendoza opened his mouth to speak, but was cut off by the colonel.
Name: Book 15

text: "Before any of you lays the proverbial egg, there is a procedure for disseminating information pertinent to your investigation.
Name: Book 15

text: My staff, and Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie from the Defense Intelligence Agency, will assist you in this process.
Name: Book 15

text: Our charge is to protect sensitive, classified information, while at the same time helping your investigation.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm sure we will all butt heads today, but I assure you we are in no way trying to hinder your progress.
Name: Book 15

text: Anything cleared by Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie will be retyped by one of my staff, either Staff Sergeant Brodin or Technical Sergeant D'Onofrie, and faxed directly to your operations center with a CIS Category Two classification.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie will make the ultimate call on what is Category One or Two, and what can be transmitted or communicated.
Name: Book 15

text: "If you see something in the files that Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie won't release via fax, then you'll need to personally carry the information in your head to your immediate director, Agent Sharpe, who will not be able to share it with anyone outside of the list.
Name: Book 15

text: Are your heads ringing yet.
Name: Book 15

text: It's a lot to process, but we'll try to make this as easy as possible for your organizations.
Name: Book 15

text: "Agent Mendoza and Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller are free to leave and reenter as they wish; however, we do require that Agents Harris and Calhoun stay within the Sanctum until the file is resealed.
Name: Book 15

text: My staff will be required to make the same sacrifice.
Name: Book 15

text: The Sanctum has full bathroom and shower facilities, cots, coffee, and you can order whatever you'd like from the canteen to be delivered at any time.
Name: Book 15

text: We'll send the bill to your agencies.
Name: Book 15

text: Spare toiletry kits can be found in the bathrooms.
Name: Book 15

text: He paused and looked directly at Mendoza and Keller.
Name: Book 15

text: "As for the two of you, anyone moving in or out of the section must do so with an escort, and you'll be subjected to our strictest security protocols on the way in and out of the building.
Name: Book 15

text: No rubber gloves, gentlemen, but you will be scanned and frisked.
Name: Book 15

text: Cell phones must be surrendered to security personnel; they are strictly prohibited in this section.
Name: Book 15

text: Wear your security badges at all times.
Name: Book 15

text: If there are no further questions, please read through the documents and sign them.
Name: Book 15

text: Once you're done, we'll get you situated in the Sanctum.
Name: Book 15

text: Entry and exit from the Sanctum is strictly controlled by me, and I will be available at all times to facilitate your comings and goings.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm here as long as you're here.
Name: Book 15

text: "Will you be stationed inside of the Sanctum with us.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Harris asked, shuffling through his paperwork.
Name: Book 15

text: I unlock and release the file to Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie.
Name: Book 15

text: Once he has confirmed that the contents of the file match the contents requested, you won't see me again inside the Sanctum until it is time to lock the file back up for good.
Name: Book 15

text: I simply serve as the gatekeeper and document custodian.
Name: Book 15

text: I have no idea what you've requested, only that the strictest of security protocols has been assigned to the handling of the information contained in the file.
Name: Book 15

text: Take a few minutes to finish the paperwork, and I'll get you situated.
Name: Book 15

text: Ten minutes later, Colonel Farrington walked out of the Sanctum, satisfied that everything was in good order.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie had enthusiastically confirmed that the contents of the vacuum-sealed, pressure-activated storage locker matched what the FBI had requested.
Name: Book 15

text: As usual, General Sanderson's intelligence was right on the money.
Name: Book 15

text: The files were stored in a single oversized, modern briefcase, which surprised Farrington.
Name: Book 15

text: Most of the files in the Sanctum had been converted to thumb drives, hard drives, or even full laptop computers.
Name: Book 15

text: The briefcase contained all of the known surviving documents pertaining to Sanderson's notoriously successful covert operations program, and judging by a glimpse of the contents from across the table, the documents were originals.
Name: Book 15

text: He sat down in his cubicle and glanced around the section.
Name: Book 15

text: He could hear activity, but didn't see anyone headed in his direction, so he reached into his briefcase and removed his cellphone.
Name: Book 15

text: He dialed one of fifteen phone numbers that he had committed to memory over the past year, in preparation for this day.
Name: Book 15

text: "Are we in business.
Name: Book 15

text: General Sanderson's voice asked immediately.
Name: Book 15

text: The files looked to be in an original form.
Name: Book 15

text: "Do you have a timeline for extraction.
Name: Book 15

text: "I have seven in the Sanctum right now, but I expect the herd to thin as they start to wade through the file.
Name: Book 15

text: Two of them will likely depart within the hour.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm looking at an early evening, possibly a late afternoon timeline.
Name: Book 15

text: "Take your time, Rich.
Name: Book 15

text: The file will be open for at least twenty-four hours, if not longer.
Name: Book 15

text: But once these files are secured, we won't have another chance," Sanderson uttered.
Name: Book 15

text: "You'll have ample opportunity, I'm sure of it.
Name: Book 15

text: Even if they suddenly shut down access to the file, you'll be the first to know.
Name: Book 15

text: I trust your skills, Colonel.
Name: Book 15

text: We've known each other for a long time.
Name: Book 15

text: Colonel Farrington's beeper vibrated, and he checked the number.
Name: Book 15

text: "I have to go, sir.
Name: Book 15

text: Looks like a few of our guests might be leaving earlier than I expected.
Name: Book 15

text: Keep me posted," the general said, and the line went dead.
Name: Book 15

text: Farrington ensured the cell phone was placed in meeting mode, to keep it silent, and grabbed his desk phone.
Name: Book 15

text: He pressed one of the conference call buttons and was immediately connected to Staff Sergeant Brodin within the Sanctum.
Name: Book 15

text: "Sir, Mr.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller wishes to depart the Sanctum," she informed him.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll be right there," he replied and glanced at the Sanctum's security door adjacent to his cubicle.
Name: Book 15

text: Colonel Farrington continued to listen without responding.
Name: Book 15

text: Sergeant Brodin lowered her voice even further.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: "I think Keller might be eidetic.
Name: Book 15

text: How long did he look through the files.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't appear to do much more than glance at the sheets, like he wasn't really paying attention.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie didn't appear to be bothered by it.
Name: Book 15

text: I just thought you should know, sir.
Name: Book 15

text: "That's why I have you in there, Staff Sergeant.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll be right over," he said and hung up the phone.
Name: Book 15

text: Fifty feet away, Julio Mendez shook his head from the safety of his "office.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Seventeen Chapter Seventeen{{{1 ### Chapter Seventeen.
Name: Book 15

text: Safe House, Alexandria, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: General Sanderson sat at a dark brown Shaker-style table in an apartment on the outskirts of Alexandria, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: He had recently acquired the unit through a real estate holding company owned by a loyal, longtime friend, a powerful friend who had more to do with the day's events than simply providing an untraceable real estate purchase.
Name: Book 15

text: Sitting at the rectangular table, he faced a sliding glass door that led to a modest balcony two stories above a lush garden and small, undisturbed pool.
Name: Book 15

text: Thick curtains gave him privacy from prying eyes on other balconies and reduced the glare from a bright, declining sun.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: A stainless steel refrigerator hummed behind him and marked the beginning of a granite and cherry cabinet appointed kitchen that filled the space to his immediate left.
Name: Book 15

text: A sizable, sparsely furnished media room loomed to his right, containing a simple dark leather couch, coffee table and wall-mounted flat-screen television.
Name: Book 15

text: Empty built-in bookshelves flanked the television.
Name: Book 15

text: The general alternated his attention among three laptop computers situated in a semi-circle on the table.
Name: Book 15

text: A tangle of wires extended over the back of the table, split between a massive power strip and a broadband modem jammed at odd angles on one of the chairs.
Name: Book 15

text: He confirmed Petrovich's flight schedule and picked up one of five cell phones sitting on the table next to the computers.
Name: Book 15

text: Each one was plugged into a charger connected to the same power strip as the computers.
Name: Book 15

text: "Our guest should be arriving shortly.
Name: Book 15

text: I want you to pick him up and find a rental car agency well away from the airport.
Name: Book 15

text: Rent a car in your name and give him your SUV.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't expect our friends to piece things together this quickly, but we can't take any chances.
Name: Book 15

text: Take him to my place north of the city, and wait for instructions.
Name: Book 15

text: Make sure to outfit our friend well.
Name: Book 15

text: I may need him at a moment's notice.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm a few minutes away from the airport.
Name: Book 15

text: Any word from Farrington.
Name: Book 15

text: "Everything is in place.
Name: Book 15

text: We're just waiting for the right moment.
Name: Book 15

text: Let me know when the two of you have arrived safely," the general said and closed the phone.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Eighteen Chapter Eighteen{{{1 ### Chapter Eighteen.
Name: Book 15

text: FBI Headquarters, Washington, D.
Name: Book 15

text: The first encrypted fax from the Pentagon arrived thirty-two minutes after Special Agent Frank Mendoza and his team entered the Sanctum.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe took custody of the sealed folder from Special Agent Keith Weber.
Name: Book 15

text: Weber's face appeared even more exhausted than this morning, though he had managed to find a new dress shirt to replace the crumpled mess he had presented to the task force this morning.
Name: Book 15

text: Since then, the pale, lanky agent had never been seen without a cup of coffee in his hands.
Name: Book 15

text: As tired as Weber might be, Sharpe was relieved to see him still functioning at full capacity.
Name: Book 15

text: As chief communications officer for the task force, Weber was unlikely to find a moment's rest in the next twenty-four hours, especially with CIS Category Two protocols blanketed over the entire task force.
Name: Book 15

text: Any breach of information security would fall squarely on his shouldersand Sharpe's.
Name: Book 15

text: All eyes in the task force's operations center drifted toward Sharpe as he broke the packet's security seal.
Name: Book 15

text: Aware of his audience, Sharpe motioned for Special Agent Dana O'Reilly, from the criminal investigation section, to join him at the front of the room.
Name: Book 15

text: As she navigated the workstations, Sharpe removed the two-page document and began to read, his face betraying no initial response to the information as he processed what Mendoza had been able to push past the Pentagon gatekeepers.
Name: Book 15

text: It was more than he had expected.
Name: Book 15

text: He handed the first sheet over to Agent O'Reilly.
Name: Book 15

text: O'Reilly was another rising star within the FBI.
Name: Book 15

text: Graduating number one in her class at the Academy, she had reported to the Los Angeles field office in 1999 and made a positive, lasting impression on Special Agent Olson, who personally requested her assignment to headquarters in 2004, several years ahead of schedule on a typical agent's career-ladder climb.
Name: Book 15

text: As usual, Olson's instincts had been dead-on, and Agent O'Reilly didn't disappoint.
Name: Book 15

text: Her investigative skill and efficiency matched her sharp, angular face and short brown hair.
Name: Book 15

text: "Agent O'Reilly, I want full workups on each of these names.
Name: Book 15

text: Start with their most current known locations and move outward.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: I'm looking for a possible geographic pattern.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz lived within easy driving distance of Newport.
Name: Book 15

text: Focus on the East Coast.
Name: Book 15

text: If their last known address isn't on the East Coast, or close, move on to the next name.
Name: Book 15

text: I want to start shaping this investigation in twenty minutes.
Name: Book 15
