text: * Chapter Nineteen Chapter Nineteen{{{1 ### Chapter Nineteen.
Name: Book 15

text: Baltimore/Washington International Airport, Baltimore, Maryland.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel Petrovich waited patiently in his seat while the 747 taxied up to the gate at BWI airport.
Name: Book 15

text: He had carefully, but surreptitiously watched the flight crew since about halfway through the two-hour flight.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd taken a calculated risk boarding a flight this late in the afternoon, but he had been assured by General Sanderson that the net wouldn't fall on him until the early evening.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel's previous experience with the general had taught him that the man was rarely wrong about anything, which is why Petrovich sensed that something was off about the day's events.
Name: Book 15

text: He glanced at the senior flight attendant, Elaine, a dark-haired, middle-aged woman who had seemed friendly enough throughout the flight.
Name: Book 15

text: If the authorities knew he was on board, he had to assume at least one member of the flight crew had been notified, and his bet was on Elaine.
Name: Book 15

text: So far, she'd only locked eyes with him twice, which was normal in Daniel's experience.
Name: Book 15

text: She didn't look away quickly, or stare at him too long.
Name: Book 15

text: Her behavior fell well within the normal parameters defined by an instinct he had sharpened to a razor's edge.
Name: Book 15

text: He survived undercover for two years among the most dangerous, unpredictable men in the world, where the slightest change in expression was often the only warning that preceded a rusty buck knife across your throat.
Name: Book 15

text: The aircraft rolled gently to a stop at the gate, and the fasten seatbelt sign was deactivated, releasing passengers to crowd the aisles.
Name: Book 15

text: He was pretty sure that the pilot would have kept the passengers in their seats if a tense, heavily-armed SWAT team waited in the jetway.
Name: Book 15

text: The woman in the middle seat next to Daniel stood, pushing into him, but Daniel gave her a cross look that made her pause.
Name: Book 15

text: She lowered herself back down, mumbling to herself.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Daniel was in a hurry, too, but not to be jostled by every manner-deprived, self- important passenger trying to get off the airplane.
Name: Book 15

text: Ten minutes later, Daniel walked through a non-automated door next to a large swivel exit.
Name: Book 15

text: He thought about how easy it would be to trap someone inside one of those large aquarium-like rotating doors, which is why he avoided it.
Name: Book 15

text: His transformation back into Marko Resja had accelerated.
Name: Book 15

text: He glanced up and down the street in the arrival pickup zone, spotting Parker's green Grand Cherokee five cars down to his right.
Name: Book 15

text: He tossed the cell phone he had used to contact Parkerand its separated batteryinto a tall, gray trash receptacle next to a concrete pillar behind the SUV.
Name: Book 15

text: He looked into the vehicle at Parker, who nodded, and heard the doors unlock.
Name: Book 15

text: Parker checked all of his mirrors, glancing around, while Daniel tossed the black nylon duffel bag into the back seat and took the front passenger seat.
Name: Book 15

text: He buckled his seatbelt, still half expecting to be rushed by federal agents from all sides.
Name: Book 15

text: Parker put the car into gear and cruised forward out of the spot, still not saying a word, which was fine with Daniel for now.
Name: Book 15

text: Once out of the airport, Parker started to navigate them toward the Baltimore Washington Parkway, which would intersect with the 495 Beltway north of Washington, D.
Name: Book 15

text: , Daniel had no idea where Parker intended to take him once they were inside the Beltway, but he had his own plans for staying quiet until the general needed him.
Name: Book 15

text: Parker finally broke the silence.
Name: Book 15

text: "General Sanderson wants me to take you to a rental car agency.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll rent another car, and you'll take mine.
Name: Book 15

text: "So he can keep track of me.
Name: Book 15

text: "He doesn't want any chance of a rental car transaction being traced to you.
Name: Book 15

text: "Does he think I'm going to use my driver's license.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel asked as Parker turned the Cherokee onto the Parkway.
Name: Book 15

text: "If the feds think you're headed to D.
Name: Book 15

text: , they'll be able to figure it out, even if you use a fake ID.
Name: Book 15

text: "Why would they assume I'm headed here.
Name: Book 15

text: I'd think this is the last place they would expect me to materialize.
Name: Book 15

text: "The general doesn't like surprises," Parker said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Then losing a man to the feds must have ruined his entire year.
Name: Book 15

text: Parker looked over at Daniel with a concerned expression.
Name: Book 15

text: "The mission was a success, but the general's come too far to take any further chances with this operation.
Name: Book 15

text: "I'll bet," Daniel said and found himself lost in thought, staring into the thick traffic headed out of D.
Name: Book 15

text: "Once we get you a car, we'll head to a safe house in Silver Spring and wait for further developments.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel didn't like the sound of this at all.
Name: Book 15

text: With one of Sanderson's men in custody, he wasn't sure how fast the entire situation would unravel, if it hadn't already spiraled out of the general's control.
Name: Book 15

text: Clearly, the general shared the same concerns, or he wouldn't have taken steps to get Daniel out of Maine so quickly.
Name: Book 15

text: Something kept bothering him, but he couldn't bring it to the surface.
Name: Book 15

text: Parker suddenly showing up yesterday with Sanderson's barely-veiled ultimatum never sat right with Daniel.
Name: Book 15

text: The Ghani killing was simple work, which didn't require his level of expertise, or exposure, and Sanderson had played a serious card to push him back into the fold.
Name: Book 15

text: Mentioning Zorana Zekulic reeked of desperation and only served to underscore the insidious link bonding Petrovich to Sanderson.
Name: Book 15

text: The SUV slowed as they joined traffic headed into the capital, and Petrovich decided that it was in his best interest to maintain a safe distance from the general until a better picture of the situation developed.
Name: Book 15

text: Given the nature of the Black Flag program, Daniel guessed that he wasn't the only program graduate with secrets that the general would rather see buried in an unmarked grave.
Name: Book 15

text: Secrets that would ruin the general's reputation permanently and possibly land him in front of a firing squadright next to Daniel.
Name: Book 15

text: He glanced around at the standstill traffic and the area surrounding the Parkway.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed to get out of this car and disappear.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller walked down a dense, tree-lined street of brownstones deep in the heart of Georgetown, until he arrived at the waist-level wrought iron gate that marked the entrance to the law offices of Hopkins, Frederick and McDonough.

text: Sanderson took a moment to consider this development, and there was an uncomfortable pause on the phone while he processed what this might mean for his plan.
Name: Book 15

text: He could never fully control Petrovich, which is why Daniel was a unique addition to the Black Flag program.
Name: Book 15

text: He had suspected this before Petrovich reported to The Ranch and quickly confirmed what the psychological exams had suggested.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich had a pathologic aversion to authority, but a conflicting need to operate loosely within a structure.
Name: Book 15

text: He caused considerable difficulty for the instructors at The Ranch, but excelled within the program.
Name: Book 15

text: Sanderson had seen the unlimited potential in Petrovich and still did.
Name: Book 15

text: Trust me, there was nothing you could do to stop him.
Name: Book 15

text: Remember what I told you.
Name: Book 15

text: Don't ever stand in his way.
Name: Book 15

text: He knows how to get in touch with us and will surface when he's ready.
Name: Book 15

text: His world was turned upside down yesterday.
Name: Book 15

text: Frankly, I'm just happy we managed to get him to D.
Name: Book 15

text: We still need him.
Name: Book 15

text: Continue to your destination, and wait.
Name: Book 15

text: He'll pop up once he's established a safe base of operations.
Name: Book 15

text: He might be better off on his own.
Name: Book 15

text: "I'll be ready to roll, sir.
Name: Book 15

text: Sounds like our man in Boston talked.
Name: Book 15

text: "Things are moving quickly.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: The feds have connected some dots from the Pentagon file, so we need to proceed cautiously," he said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Sit tight and wait.
Name: Book 15

text: That's about all we can do at this point," he said and ended the call.
Name: Book 15

text: He purposely neglected to inform Parker of a disturbing element uncovered by Colonel Farrington at the Pentagon.
Name: Book 15

text: There existed a distinct possibility that the CIA liaison to the FBI was able to commit large portions of the Black Flag file to memory.
Name: Book 15

text: He knew that the information approved for release from the file would be carefully screened by Derren McKie, one of the few people entrusted with its contents, but if McKie didn't suspect a photographic memory, the CIA liaison officer could easily take advantage of the situation.
Name: Book 15

text: The fact that Randy Keller spent less than fifteen minutes in The Sanctum suggested that he had seen enough.
Name: Book 15

text: Sanderson had grave concerns about the CIA discovering Petrovich's Serbian alias, Marko Resja.
Name: Book 15

text: In the wrong hands, this information could ignite a powder keg.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Twenty-Two Chapter Twenty-Two{{{1 ### Chapter Twenty-Two.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg sat buried in the leather chair with an open laptop perched on one of the chair's oversized arms.
Name: Book 15

text: The light emanating downward from the decorative lamp competed with the illumination cast from the laptop screen, casting a pale, ugly glow on his impassive face.
Name: Book 15

text: His eyes scanned the laptop screen, oblivious to Keller, who typed away furiously on the couch.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller was recreating the documents he had memorized at an unbelievable pace.
Name: Book 15

text: So far, he had typed twenty pages in under thirty minutes, and his pace was quickening.
Name: Book 15

text: According to Keller, he had memorized over a hundred pages of material, but was still unable to adequately peruse over half of the file under McKie's watchful eye.
Name: Book 15

text: Suddenly, his eyes narrowed and froze on the screen, and he lifted his tumbler off the table, draining the remains of his Chivas refill in one long gulp.
Name: Book 15

text: Page twenty-one is another partial, right.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie had removed this page from the first stack that he cleared for our group to examine, but I got a close enough look to make a partial imprint.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm typing these out in the order that I saw them.
Name: Book 15

text: It's easier for me that way.
Name: Book 15

text: Can you remember if you saw the name Marko Resja anywhere else in the file.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller closed his eyes for a moment, scanning his memory.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened them when the answer came to him.
Name: Book 15

text: McKie withheld a sizable portion of the file from us.
Name: Book 15

text: I assumed these were operational aspects of Black Flag, so I tried to imprint what I could see.
Name: Book 15

text: I didn't want to push it.
Name: Book 15

text: The name appeared at the top of what looked like an after-action report.
Name: Book 15

text: "Yeahthe name jumped out at me, but I can't place it," Berg said absently, still staring at the name on the screen.
Name: Book 15

text: "Do you think it's an undercover name used by one of the operatives.
Name: Book 15

text: Might be an active contact.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm going to run this on the computer in the communications room, try and link the name to an active file.
Name: Book 15

text: Keep plugging away at those files.
Name: Book 15

text: The FBI expects you to make a report, but they might become suspicious if you're gone for too long.
Name: Book 15

text: We probably have another hour.
Name: Book 15

text: Focus on more names," Berg said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Right," Keller said, his fingers flying over the laptop's keyboard.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg closed his laptop and started to walk out of the room.
Name: Book 15

text: He gave the bottle of Chivas a wishful glance, but decided that the last thing he needed to do was stoke the raging fire that burned inside of him.
Name: Book 15

text: He patted Keller on the shoulder from behind the couch and left the room.
Name: Book 15

text: He stopped just outside of the room, taking a few moments to gather his thoughts.
Name: Book 15

text: He was aware that Claire was probably watching him from a hidden camera, so he didn't want to linger too long.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't want to draw any attention to himself, especially if his instincts about the Black Flag program were correct.
Name: Book 15

text: He continued moving down the hall to the communications room.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: He entered a six-digit code into the touch pad, which lowered the fingerprint reader.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: A deep blue light pulsed on the reader as Berg pressed his thumb down on the glass.
Name: Book 15

text: A few seconds passed, and the light turned bright green, followed by a faint pneumatic hissing sound from the door.
Name: Book 15

text: He grabbed the doorknob, but didn't bother to turn it.
Name: Book 15

text: Instead, he just pushed the door open and quickly walked in.
Name: Book 15

text: The door closed and he once again heard the pneumatic hiss, which was always louder on this side.
Name: Book 15

text: He turned and faced the room, which left a lot to be desired compared to the lounge.
Name: Book 15

text: The lighting was harsh, provided by overhead fluorescent ceiling lights that were activated upon entry.
Name: Book 15

text: Specifications for all of the CIA's secure communications rooms were strictly uniform, and Berg had learned years ago that there was little chance of receiving authorization to change anything.
Name: Book 15

text: Adding to the misery of the lighting, the walls were unceremoniously painted white, which, combined with the pneumatic hiss of the door, always made him feel like he had just stepped into a mental rehabilitation room.
Name: Book 15

text: He figured that the effect was intentional, designed to create a feeling of immediate discomfort.
Name: Book 15

text: He could understand why.
Name: Book 15

text: From this room, he could directly access the CIA's secure data banks.
Name: Book 15

text: Two computer stations sat against opposite walls of the narrow room, each containing a keyboard and two flat-screen monitors.
Name: Book 15

text: The CPU's were locked below each station in a tamper-proof casement.
Name: Book 15

text: A black business phone sat next to each computer.
Name: Book 15

text: Each phone contained the newest STU-III encryption software, designed to garble any attempts to intercept a conversation.
Name: Book 15

text: There were no printers and no paper for taking notes.
Name: Book 15

text: Several folding chairs sat stacked against the windowless outer wall of the room, further emphasizing the fact that the CIA didn't want anyone spending too much time in this room.
Name: Book 15

text: Unknown to Berg, his entrance to the room had been noted and ultimately approved by a duty technician at Langley.
Name: Book 15

text: The access code and fingerprint device had confirmed his identity for the technician, who ultimately made the decision to grant him access.
Name: Book 15

text: A small note electronically sent by Claire gave the technician an added level of confidence that it was indeed Karl Berg, Assistant Director for Counterterrorism, who stood in front of the door.
Name: Book 15

text: The technicians liked this additional confirmation because once inside the communications room, Berg had open access to all CIA files appropriate to his security clearance.
Name: Book 15

text: A detailed record of his activity would be electronically filed for future reference and random audits, but beyond that, there was no way to actively manage the content Berg could access.
Name: Book 15

text: The stand-alone communications rooms always presented the greatest risks to classified information.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg unfolded one of the gray chairs and placed it in front of the computer station on the right side of the room.
Name: Book 15

text: He turned on both monitors and nudged the mouse, which activated the sleeping CPU.
Name: Book 15

text: Within seconds, he stared at a warning screen with the standard CIA disclosures about classified information.
Name: Book 15

text: He clicked "acknowledge," and was directed to a screen that required a six- digit numeric access code and ten character password, which were both changed monthly.
Name: Book 15

text: After typing both codes, the computer took a few moments to launch the CIA data interface.
Name: Book 15

text: He immediately transferred the data interface to both screens, which would give him the ability to conduct two separate searches.
Name: Book 15

text: He typed "Marko Resja Serbian Paramilitary" into one of the interfaces, and the system began processing the request.
Name: Book 15

text: While the CIA database searched away, Berg opened his own laptop and placed it on the workstation, pushing the phone unit out of the way.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller's typed pages flashed up onto the laptop screen, and he could see that Keller was still furiously adding to the report.
Name: Book 15

text: The wireless signal connecting the two laptops was still intact, even inside of the communications room, which surprised Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: He wasted no time searching through the list of Black Flag operatives for characteristics that would narrow his search.
Name: Book 15

text: He narrowed the list of eighty names in half by eliminating the obvious.
Name: Book 15

text: Keller had identified five areas of operation served by the Black Flag program: Serbia, Colombia, Russia, Mexico and Afghanistan, so Berg discarded any Latino or Arabic names.
Name: Book 15

text: He sorted the remaining list for Serbian names, which would serve as a starting point for comparison to Marko Resja.
Name: Book 15

text: Six names jumped out at him, but about a dozen more could fit.
Name: Book 15

text: He eliminated the obvious Russian names.
Name: Book 15

text: He chose a different interface imbedded within the CIA database for this search and was directed to the FBI's nationwide database, which contained publicly available information, giving him access to criminal records information.
Name: Book 15

text: He started a multiple search string with three of six Serbian names, which was the system's limit, and waited.
Name: Book 15

text: An image flashed on the first screen, and Berg found himself staring at a face he had tried to push out of his memory for the past several years.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't need to familiarize himself with Resja's file, he just needed the picture for comparison.
Name: Book 15

text: Files for the first three names appeared on the second screen, each headed by a picture presumably taken for a driver's license.
Name: Book 15

text: The FBI's sophisticated system would display any confirmed pictures associated with the name, and in most cases, this would be a state license photograph.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg immediately compared the three images to the picture of Resja.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't see any resemblance, so he entered the next three names and waited.
Name: Book 15

text: The results appeared within seconds, and Berg felt an adrenaline rush.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the pictures was a possible match.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened the file to look at the rest of the pictures, drawing in a deep breath as eight photos filled the screen.
Name: Book 15

text: Three of the pictures showed Petrovich in various naval uniforms.
Name: Book 15

text: The highest rank evident in the pictures was ensign, denoted by single gold bars on his uniform collar.
Name: Book 15

text: The earliest photograph pictured Petrovich in the navy's summer white uniform and had likely been taken immediately after receiving his commission as an officer in the United States Navy.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich looked young and optimistic, very different from the malevolent image staring back at him from the single photograph displayed on the other screen.
Name: Book 15

text: Three additional photos had been provided from different state driver's licenses in Illinois, Massachusetts and California, but evoked no response from Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: The last picture showed Petrovich in a blue oxford dress shirt and looked like the most recently taken picture.
Name: Book 15

text: There was very little trace of Marko Resja in the last image, though it was clear that they were pictures of the same man.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg's attention was drawn to one of the photos showing Petrovich in a khaki uniform, standing with his arms crossed, on the steel deck of a warship.
Name: Book 15

text: Industrial buildings loomed in the background, indicating that the picture had been taken while the ship was docked.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich's dark wavy hair was long and unkempt, pushing the limits of the navy's loose grooming standards.
Name: Book 15

text: His face looked weathered and exhausted, staring with hatred at an object out of the camera's view.
Name: Book 15

text: The expression matched the face of Marko Resja on the other screen.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg couldn't believe he had stumbled upon this coincidence.
Name: Book 15

text: He had dreamed about this moment since March 24th, 2003, when Dejan Kavich testified in the trial of Srecko Hadzic, leader of the Serbian Radical Party and infamous commander of "The Panthers.
Name: Book 15

text: The International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia (ICTY) had already spent two weeks presenting evidence against Hadzic and would soon convict him of running an organized campaign of genocide in the Kosovar border territories.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg had a very personal interest in Hadzic's trial.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the CIA's long established undercover agents in Serbia had vanished without a trace toward the middle of April in 1999, leaving Berg and the CIA stunned.
Name: Book 15

text: The disappearance was especially difficult for Berg.
Name: Book 15

text: He had been assigned to groom the agent for the Serbian assignment in 1991, when she was first assigned to the National Clandestine Service.
Name: Book 15

text: A recent graduate from Loyola University in Chicago, Nicole Erak had scored perfect on every aptitude test used to measure a candidate's suitability for clandestine field assignment, and she spoke flawless Serbian.
Name: Book 15

text: As a first generation Serbian-American, raised in a predominately Serbian suburb of Chicago, near Palos Hill, Illinois, her recruitment was no coincidence.
Name: Book 15

text: The CIA had a critical shortage of reliable human intelligence flowing from the Balkans, and she was fast-tracked for deployment to the rapidly deteriorating region.
Name: Book 15

text: Two years after her recruitment by a low-profile history professor at Loyola University, Nicole was absorbed into Belgrade's gritty underworld as Zorana Zekulic, where she would emerge hanging on the arms of some of the most notorious men in Europe.
Name: Book 15

text: Ten years after seeing Nicole for the last time, Berg was reading transcripts of the trial, still searching for any possible clues about her disappearance, when he came across the testimony of Dejan Kavich, a low-level enforcer within Hadzic's Panther organization.
Name: Book 15

text: Kavich recounted dozens of instances where Hadzic had personally ordered the murder of civilians and suspected Kosovar militants, which was nothing new coming from the long string of witnesses that had turned on Hadzic in exchange for Tribunal leniency.
Name: Book 15

text: However, the Tribunal prosecutors asked Kavich to repeat the details of an incident that they thought would demonstrate Hadzic's ruthless nature, and this is where Berg's interest piqued.
Name: Book 15

text: Kavich described a bloody and hectic week in Belgrade at the beginning of April in 1999, which was nearly the same timeframe associated with Nicole's disappearance.
Name: Book 15

text: Though NATO jets were still hampered by thick overcast skies, blood flowed on the streets of Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: At the time, Kavich thought that the sudden civil war between two of Serbia's most powerful paramilitary groups was a simple blood feud sparked by the unprovoked murder and mutilation of Hadzic's handicapped brother.
Name: Book 15

text: His security chief, Radovan Grahovac, had also been killed in the bizarre attack, along with his entire personal security entourage, which suggested that there was more to the event than a simple blood feud.
Name: Book 15

text: After years of investigative research, the Tribunal now understood why Hadzic had initiated a self-destructive war against rival paramilitary leader Mirko Jovic's "White Eagles.
Name: Book 15

text: He not only suffered the loss of his brother and trusted security chief in the brazenly twisted attack, but more importantly to Hadzic, he had been robbed of his entire criminal fortune.
Name: Book 15

text: Confiscated bank records showed a sudden, systematic transfer of his wealth out of long-held European bank accounts to new accounts scattered throughout the Caribbean and South America.
Name: Book 15

text: From there, the money vanished along an untraceable trail of wire transfers.
Name: Book 15

text: Some of the money had been transferred by Hadzic himself at the outset of NATO hostilities, but one hundred and thirty million dollars suddenly left Europe on April 23, 1999, and it all had previously belonged to Hadzic.
Name: Book 15

text: The result was predictable for a man already considered to be one of the most ruthless and fickle psychopaths in Europe.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic dispatched his most trusted Panthers to take immediate revenge, and he particularly wanted to avenge his brother's death.
Name: Book 15

text: Pavle Hadzic had been found hacked to death in his wheelchair, the obvious victim of an infamous White Eagle enforcer, Goran Lujic, who had used an ice-climbing axe as his personal calling card for over a decade on the Belgrade organized crime scene.
Name: Book 15

text: Kavich had participated in two ambushes in Belgrade on the first day of hostilities and was almost killed the next day in a retaliatory raid by White Eagle commandos on a Panther safe house in Zemun, but the Tribunal wasn't interested in the back and forth fighting between paramilitary groups.
Name: Book 15

text: The Hague wanted to pin as many civilian murders on Hadzic as the Tribunal jury could tolerate, and Kavich knew of a particularly gruesome murder.
Name: Book 15

text: On one of the deadlier nights of fighting, Kavich witnessed a bizarre exchange between Hadzic and a trusted Panther sniper, Marko Resja, in the basement of a safe house hidden deep inside a run-down suburb of Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja had arrived by himself, wearing a bloodstained, mud-caked camouflage uniform devoid of any insignia.
Name: Book 15

text: A black watch cap was pulled tight over his head to merge with a face smeared black and brown with grease.
Name: Book 15

text: He walked into the basement carrying a Dragunov sniper rifle in one hand and a large blue nylon duffel bag in the other.
Name: Book 15

text: Kavich was located at the bottom of the basement stairs when Resja was searched in the landing off the kitchen.
Name: Book 15

text: He heard one of the guards utter, "Oh fuck," and became momentarily alarmed, but the guard called down, "All clear," and he heard Resja descend the stairs.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja gave Kavich a barely discernible nod as he passed by, which wasn't unusual.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja was all business and didn't fraternize with many of the Panthers.
Name: Book 15

text: He spent most of his time in the field stalking Kosovar militia.
Name: Book 15

text: On that particular night, Resja walked into the room and slung the rifle over his shoulder, freeing one of his hands.
Name: Book 15

text: He was immediately greeted by Hadzic, who shook his hand enthusiastically and slapped him on the shoulder.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja responded with a rare display of friendliness and banter, before he tossed the duffel bag onto the floor and declared that "he had gotten to the bottom of their problem.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic told the nearest Panther to show him what was in the bag, and the burly guard standing next to Resja kneeled down on the floor and opened the zipper.
Name: Book 15

text: The unmistakable stench of rotting flesh filled the room immediately, and the burly guard gagged, mumbling protests against touching the contents.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic ordered him to remove the contents, and the guard took in a deep breath before turning back to the bag.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja softly told him to, "Take out Lujic first," and this caused some confusion for the guard.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja added, "He's the one with the short hair.
Name: Book 15

text: At this point, everyone in the room was deathly quiet, waiting for the guard to reach into the bag, which he did reluctantly, using both hands to remove the severed head of Goran Lujic, Pavle Hadzic's presumed murderer.
Name: Book 15

text: Goran's face had been brutally beaten, showing extensive bruising and pulverized eye sockets.
Name: Book 15

text: One of his ears was missing, which Kavich learned was the result of Resja's extensively thorough torture routine.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja announced that Lujic had confessed to torturing Pavle, for access information to Hadzic's accounts, and eventually killing him.
Name: Book 15

text: The money was promptly transferred to accounts owned by Lujic's boss, Mirko Jovic, leader of "The White Eagles.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja added that he had hacked off Lujic's head with the same axe used against Pavle.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic nodded with stunned approval and looked down at the bag, which contained still another surprise.
Name: Book 15

text: While squirming under the knife, Lujic had implicated someone close to the Panther organization.
Name: Book 15

text: He told Resja that they had learned of Pavle's access to the money through a woman that frequented the company of Radovan Grahovac's men in Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: Apparently Radovan, or one of his close associates, suffered from loose lips while under the spell of liquor and beautiful women.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the nightclub regulars had learned that Pavle actively managed his brother's vast monetary fortune, and the rest was history.
Name: Book 15

text: Marko had found her hiding in a small White Eagle safe house on the outskirts of Belgrade and used the same axe on her.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic grew impatient while Resja explained and demanded to see the other head, but it was obvious that the guard still holding Lujic's head was in no condition to pull another one out of the bag.
Name: Book 15

text: He was barely holding onto the first.
Name: Book 15

text: On Resja's cue, he dropped the head back into the bag, which made an awful thunk against the concrete floor.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja impassively pulled the other severed head out of the bag, his hand wrapped tightly around a long, thick spread of filthy, matted black hair.
Name: Book 15

text: He announced, "Zorana Zekulic," and "held the head up high, like Perseus is often pictured holding the Gorgon Medusa's severed head.
Name: Book 15

text: Zekulic had been beaten worse than Lujic, bruises and contusions covering nearly every square centimeter of her once beautiful, angular face.
Name: Book 15

text: Both eyes had been gouged out, and she was only identifiable by her long hair and a single diamond stud nose ring, which was miraculously still visible on her battered nose.
Name: Book 15

text: A few members of the Tribunal had chuckled at Kavich's obviously coached reference to Greek mythology, even admonishing the prosecution to cut the theatrics, but according to Kavich, nobody had laughed in that putrid, candlelit basement of the safe house.
Name: Book 15

text: Everybody in that room knew Zorana, and everybody in that room had partied in the clubs with her at some point very recently.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic had probably seen every one of them alone in her company within the past month, and the implications of her treachery were apparent to even the dimmest of henchmen huddled in that basement.
Name: Book 15

text: They all wanted to run for the staircase because Hadzic looked like he had reached the point of critical mass.
Name: Book 15

text: "I hope you fucked her corpse," Kavich remembered him saying to Resja, before demanding to see the head of Mirko Jovic in the same bag.
Name: Book 15

text: Resja told Hadzic, "I'll see what I can do," and walked out of the basement.
Name: Book 15

text: When asked what happened to Resja, Kavich commented that nobody ever saw him again.
Name: Book 15

text: They all assumed he had been killed trying to find Jovic and ended up in one of dozens of unmarked mass graves found in the fields surrounding Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg remembered reading the transcript of Kavich's testimony with a strange sense of detachment.
Name: Book 15

text: He had finally uncovered Nicole Erak's fate and the name of the man who had brutally killed her, but he felt no closure.
Name: Book 15

text: Hadzic was eventually convicted of Lujic's murder, but no formal charges were filed against Hadzic pertaining to the brutal murder of Zorana Zekulic.
Name: Book 15

text: The Hague issued a warrant and summons for Marko Resja, adding another name to the already impossibly long list of thugs and murderers associated with the paramilitary groups that flourished under Slobodan Milosevic's regime.
Name: Book 15

text: Nobody cared about finding Marko Resja except the CIA, and Berg knew that even the CIA's interest had a limited half-life.
Name: Book 15

text: Agency attempts to locate information regarding Marko Resja led nowhere.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg and other members of the CIA wanted to find Resja and make him pay horribly for Nicole's death, but Resja had indeed disappeared shortly after Nicole's murder.
Name: Book 15

text: Belgrade in the spring of 1999 had a way of eating people up and spitting them out.
Name: Book 15

text: The memory of Nicole Erak's murder faded quickly at Langley.
Name: Book 15

text: One year after Berg read Kavich's testimony, a star was added to The Memorial Wall in the Original Headquarters Building in honor of Nicole's sacrifice, but no name was added to the Book of Honor below it.
Name: Book 15

text: The nature and fact of Nicole Erak's service to the United States would remain a guarded secret for eternity.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg had attended the ceremony, which always drew a smaller crowd when the name was unknown.
Name: Book 15

text: He shared a few knowing glances and returned to his office to move on.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: With the War on Terror in full swing throughout the Middle East, turmoil in the Balkans was the least of the CIA's worries.
Name: Book 15

text: The Counterterrorism Center demanded his full attention, which he'd delivered uninterrupted, until about five minutes ago.
Name: Book 15

text: Reading the name Marko Resja on Keller's report hit Berg like a sledgehammer, bringing him right back to the moment he read Kavich's testimony.
Name: Book 15

text: His mind flashed to the details of Nicole's mutilation and murder, and he jumped into action, immediately deciding that if Resja's face matched one of the operatives listed on the Black Flag roster, he wouldn't stop until Resja was dead.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg tapped a few more keys, and a new screen replaced Resja's file.
Name: Book 15

text: He entered a separate access code and found himself staring at a new file matrix.
Name: Book 15

text: He searched the list for Nicole's code name, Seraph, and opened the file.
Name: Book 15

text: The words "deceased" filled the top of the screen, just above a searchable image gallery.
Name: Book 15

text: He stared at the images displayed by the system.
Name: Book 15

text: The first picture was taken by CIA interviewers outside of Loyola University in Chicago and showed a classically beautiful young woman.
Name: Book 15

text: She had soft, light brown eyes and jet black hair.
Name: Book 15

text: Typical of mixed Balkan descent, her skin carried an olive complexion, giving her a unique exotic quality among descendants of northern Serbs, but not enough to draw the wrong kind of nationalist attention in Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: She wore an optimistic, yet guarded smile in the picture, appropriate for a sharp, observant young woman being photographed by complete strangers in a rented apartment on the north side of Chicago.
Name: Book 15

text: The second picture was taken during an early phase of CIA training and showed much less of the idealistic young college graduate.
Name: Book 15

text: Taken in one of the classrooms at headquarters, it showed a close-up of Nicole seated behind a desk, staring skeptically at one of the instructors.
Name: Book 15

text: By this point, she probably understood that she was not being trained to sit behind a desk in McLean, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: Lying to family and friends about the nature of her employment had become second nature, and she might have strongly suspected, by the intensity and subject matter of her training, that her role within the National Clandestine Service would be atypical.
Name: Book 15

text: She wasn't receiving the same diplomatic role-play training given to field agents assigned to cover positions at U.
Name: Book 15

text: embassies around the world.
Name: Book 15

text: The third image barely resembled the young woman who had reported to Langley a mere two years earlier.
Name: Book 15

text: Several close-up shots had been snapped by an embassy "employee" in Belgrade and caught her exiting a popular caf on Knez Mihailova Street, near the Serbian Academy of Sciences and Art.
Name: Book 15

text: She wore a gray turtleneck sweater under a tight black leather jacket.
Name: Book 15

text: Black, knee-high leather boots rose up to meet a tight, dark maroon half skirt, leaving several inches of skin along her legs exposed to the cold Balkan winter.
Name: Book 15

text: Her black hair was pulled back into a tight bun, accentuating her exotic face.
Name: Book 15

text: From a distance, she looked like any well-dressed, cosmopolitan woman on the streets of Manhattan, but the next image showed a different story.
Name: Book 15

text: He clicked on a close-up of her face, and it showed signs of weariness.
Name: Book 15

text: Heavy eye shadow outlined her eyes, but couldn't hide the exhaustion.
Name: Book 15

text: A small diamond nose ring poked out of her left nostril.
Name: Book 15

text: This had been recommended by members of Clandestine Branch responsible for creating her cover "legend," since it was a trend popular among women on the "professional" nightclub scene in Europe, especially Paris, where Zorana Zekulic had spent the last five years studying art and partying.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg studied the photo closely.
Name: Book 15

text: Attractive, sexy, an object to behold in Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: But very little trace of Nicole broke through the icy exterior shell she had formed after a year in Belgrade.
Name: Book 15

text: He felt terrible for what had happened to her.
Name: Book 15

text: She had spent six years in the company of some of the worst monsters in recent human history, spying on them, coaxing information out of them using methods he refused to contemplate.
Name: Book 15

text: All to be murdered and only God knew what else at the very end of her assignment.
Name: Book 15

text: The entire Milosevic regime had been about to collapse, and the CIA wanted her out of Belgrade before the NATO bombing started.
Name: Book 15

text: All she had to do was drive over the border into Hungary or Romania.
Name: Book 15

text: Less than a two-hour drive in either direction, and she could have put it all behind her.
Name: Book 15

text: She refused to leave.
Name: Book 15

text: Her handler, another deep-cover operative assigned to Serbia, had stressed that she was no longer mentally stable enough to remain in place, and that she had begun to show signs of severe schizophrenia.
Name: Book 15

text: According to his report, she believed she was Zorana Zekulic and had lost the ability to fully understand her reality.
Name: Book 15

text: Based on his report and the rapidly deteriorating situation in Serbia, the CIA authorized a forced extraction.
Name: Book 15

text: A plan was formed by special operators to kidnap her from the streets of Belgrade, but Nicole vanished before the plan could be executed.
Name: Book 15

text: A fourth picture showed Zorana Zekulic five years into her assignment.
Name: Book 15

text: Every trace of Nicole Erak's essence had been erased.
Name: Book 15

text: They had kept her in place too long, and it had killed her long before Marko Resja came along with Lujic's axe.
Name: Book 15

text: He wondered if death hadn't been the best thing for her in the long run.
Name: Book 15

text: Nicole had drawn some bad cards in life.
Name: Book 15

text: She was raised by abusive parents, in a household that survived from week to week, never rising far above the poverty line.
Name: Book 15

text: CIA psychological interviews and polygraph results suggested sexual abuse, which she successfully refuted on further polygraphs, but Berg never believed the results.
Name: Book 15

text: He was convinced that she had either beaten the machine, or that the memories had been buried.
Name: Book 15

text: Winning a full scholarship to Loyola was one of the first good cards she pulled from the deck.
Name: Book 15

text: Attracting the attention of a CIA recruiter was another ace, and by the time the CIA asked her to report to Langley, she held a royal flush.
Name: Book 15

text: Unfortunately, she had to draw new cards at the CIA, and she drew the worst cards possible.
Name: Book 15

text: The CIA was desperate to unravel the mess developing in the Balkans, and Nicole's skill sets made her the perfect match for the job.
Name: Book 15

text: Based on the inconsistencies with her psych profile, they should have known better than to send her at these men and then keep her there for six years.
Name: Book 15

text: But what choice did the CIA have.
Name: Book 15

text: Her situation was unique, and it provided the most useful information to come out of Serbia in decades.
Name: Book 15

text: Nobody at Langley was willing to admit it, but they would have kept her there indefinitely if the situation hadn't imploded with NATO's involvement.
Name: Book 15

text: He closed Nicole's file, perfectly aware that opening it might have triggered an alert in someone's email box back in Langley.
Name: Book 15

text: He had no intention of using official channels to take care of things.
Name: Book 15

text: Plenty of people owed Berg serious favors in this town, and he planned to cash in on a few of them.
Name: Book 15

text: He navigated to the CIA's file on General Sanderson, scanning it for a piece of information he had come across earlier.
Name: Book 15

text: He found the name, James Parker, quickly, and memorized several pieces of information that would give his friends a head start on finding Daniel Petrovich.
Name: Book 15

text: He quickly closed down the computer, leaving the room as he found it.
Name: Book 15

text: Standing in the hallway, he pulled out his cell phone and placed a call to the National Security Agency.
Name: Book 15

text: The call didn't last very long, but it set in motion a series of highly illegal surveillance protocols designed to find and track Parker.
Name: Book 15

text: The second call would have to wait, but not for very long.
Name: Book 15

text: He had plans for Daniel Petrovich, or whoever he currently claimed to be.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg would make sure he didn't live for very long.
Name: Book 15

text: If possible, he'd be there to kill Resja himself.
Name: Book 15

text: He had no idea how Petrovich had become Marko Resja, and he didn't really care.
Name: Book 15

text: It had something to do with Black Flag, but that wasn't his problem.
Name: Book 15

text: He had searched the CIA's files on Sanderson and found not a single mention of the general's secret program.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd let the FBI decipher Black Flag, while he focused on Petrovich.
Name: Book 15

text: Under the right circumstances, he might learn more about the clandestine program than Keller or the FBI combined.
Name: Book 15

text: He was pretty sure the right circumstances would involve the purchase of a climbing axe from a sporting goods store in Bailey's Crossing, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Twenty-Three Chapter Twenty-Three{{{1 ### Chapter Twenty-Three.
Name: Book 15

text: Brown River Security Corporation, Fredericksburg, Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: Darryl Jackson hung up the phone and contemplated his situation.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't like it, but he owed Karl Berg more than a weekend favor.
Name: Book 15

text: He owed Berg his life.
Name: Book 15

text: Four years earlier, Jackson and a small crew of Brown River paramilitary contractors found themselves fighting for their lives in a small wadi outside of Sorubi, Afghanistan, when Berg reached down from the sky to save him.
Name: Book 15

text: While conducting a site reconnaissance along highway A1, on behalf of the newly arrived U.
Name: Book 15

text: Central Command forces, his convoy of two Land Rovers stumbled into a platoon-sized group of Taliban militants, who had just broken camp to move further south toward the safety of the Taliban-controlled mountains near Khowst.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Within minutes, Jackson had lost both vehicles and half of his eight-man contingent.
Name: Book 15

text: With his satellite phone destroyed in one of the mangled SUVs, Jackson was on his own until someone at Brown River's operations center back in Kabul declared them missing.
Name: Book 15

text: Jackson's team retreated to the cover of a dried up river bed and set up a perimeter to hold the Taliban at bay.
Name: Book 15

text: Jackson's highly trained team had already inflicted serious casualties on the Taliban force, and he hoped that the Taliban leadership in the group would decide against suffering further unnecessary losses.
Name: Book 15

text: Minutes later, a suicide attack on his position scrapped any hopes that the enraged hornet's nest of Muslim extremists would abandon their quarry.
Name: Book 15

text: The attack broke through his perimeter, killing one more member of his team, but the wave of militants suffered enough casualties to cause a temporary withdrawal to the cover of Jackson's disabled Land Rovers.
Name: Book 15

text: He counted at least twenty Taliban in the vicinity of the trucks, who had now started an organized volley of rocket propelled grenades.
Name: Book 15

text: A smaller group moved along Jackson's left flank.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Everyone in his team was wounded at this point, and when he caught sight of the flanking movement, he knew they wouldn't last another five minutes.
Name: Book 15

text: Then he heard a familiar buzzing sound.
Name: Book 15

text: He could barely lift his head high enough to scan the entire expanse of blue, as bullets snapped past his head.
Name: Book 15

text: He heard a muffled scream and a curse, turning to see a member of his team grimace while pressing a blood-soaked hand down on his thigh.
Name: Book 15

text: In his peripheral vision, Jackson caught a glimpse of something moving in the sky.
Name: Book 15

text: The buzzing sound returned.
Name: Book 15

text: One of his men yelled something encouraging and pointed to the drone, but Jackson wasn't optimistic.
Name: Book 15

text: To him, the Predator drone simply meant that a crew in Nevada would watch their deaths live on camera.
Name: Book 15

text: Jackson wasn't completely correct about the location of the crew.
Name: Book 15

text: The RQ-1 Predator drone circling overhead was indeed controlled by an air force officer at an undisclosed location in Nevada, but the video feed had the undivided attention of CIA officers in the Counterterrorism Center at Langley, who had requisitioned the flight to assess reports of an Al Qaeda way station operating outside of Sorubi.
Name: Book 15

text: Osama Bin Laden's location remained a mystery, though there was little doubt that he would seek refuge in the mountains near Khowst.
Name: Book 15

text: Electronic intercepts suggested that he had not reached this destination, and the CIA was very interested in any possible points of refuge along his projected escape route.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg watched the attack unfold from the drone's cameras, and an argument developed within the operations center about whether to render assistance to the civilian team on the ground.
Name: Book 15

text: The drone carried two Hellfire air-to-ground missiles, which could easily turn the tide against the militants, but several of the officers within the center wanted to save the missiles for high-value targets at the suspected Al Qaeda rest stop.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg quickly ended the argument.
Name: Book 15

text: As deputy assistant of the Counterterrorism Center, the Predator flight was under his control, and he had no intention of abandoning the men on the ground.
Name: Book 15

text: He relayed orders to the controllers in Nevada.
Name: Book 15

text: Thousands of miles away, Jackson took a grazing hit to his right shoulder, which caused him to hug the ground at a time they couldn't afford.
Name: Book 15

text: Three guns were barely keeping the Taliban from organizing another rush of the shallow wadi.
Name: Book 15

text: Just as Jackson said a prayer and lifted his body up to continue firing, he was hit with a concussion that snapped his head backward and slid him down the side of the river bed.
Name: Book 15

text: A second shockwave fired through his small group, rolling Jackson onto his back.
Name: Book 15

text: Jackson still held his rifle tight and waited for bearded heads to appear over the riverbank's edge to finish them, but nothing materialized.
Name: Book 15

text: He painfully scooted through the loose gravel to continue firing at the Taliban positions, but the scene in front of him had been altered by forty pounds of high explosive charge.
Name: Book 15

text: The shattered Land Rover hulks now sat thirty feet closer to Jackson, completely engulfed in flames.
Name: Book 15

text: To his left, the Taliban flanking movement had been obliterated by another strike, which left a charred dead zone among the low rocks.
Name: Book 15

text: Jackson scanned the sky above, but couldn't find their savior.
Name: Book 15

text: He swore an oath to find the man responsible for diverting the Predator drone, knowing that the defense of paramilitary contractors was a low priority on the military's list of uses for expensive Hellfire missiles.
Name: Book 15

text: He finally met Berg two years later at Brown River's headquarters in Fredericksburg, Virginia, and they had since become inseparable.
Name: Book 15

text: Darryl Jackson spun his chair around and opened a file cabinet drawer.
Name: Book 15

text: He thumbed through the red files, pulling the one with the appropriate rosters.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed to assemble a uniquely loyal team of highly capable special operators and have them standing by inside of D.
Name: Book 15

text: within an hour, which would be a miracle during rush hour.
Name: Book 15

text: Their target was a rogue freelance operative that posed a significant threat to U.
Name: Book 15

text: security, and Berg felt certain that this operative would arrive in the D.
Name: Book 15

text: area tonight.
Name: Book 15

text: He wanted the Brown River team to capture or kill the operative as soon as he surfaced.
Name: Book 15

text: It was clear that Berg didn't want the team to attract any attention, and Jackson didn't even bother to ask if the mission was authorized.
Name: Book 15

text: Berg said the rogue agent was "black flagged," and that was all Jackson needed to hear.
Name: Book 15

text: He turned back to his desk and picked up the phone to start making calls.
Name: Book 15

text: The next exit sat at least thirty minutes away in the heavy traffic, and Parker couldn't afford to attract the wrong kind of attention.

text: He imagined that Parker's next phone call had been a tough one.

text: It took Petrovich about fifteen minutes to navigate his way to a rental car agency in Laurel, Maryland, and another ten minutes to drive away under one of his three remaining false identities.

Name: Book 15

text: He rented the car and took the hotel room under the name Scott Barber, an untraceable New Jersey resident, leaving him with two more clean ID packages.
Name: Book 15

text: Once he left the hotel room tonight, he was unlikely to return and would be forced to dispose of Barber's ID pack.
Name: Book 15

text: He was running out of identities, but suspected that General Sanderson could help him with this problem.
Name: Book 15

text: General Sanderson assured him that his role wouldn't extend past tomorrow evening, so he shouldn't need another hotel room.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel turned his attention to the maps and started to unfold them.
Name: Book 15

text: He needed to quickly familiarize himself with the details of D.
Name: Book 15

text: 's mass transit system and stick close to locations that offered him rapid escape options beyond the rental car.
Name: Book 15

text: His starting point was the Metro rail map and familiarizing himself with the different lines and timetables.
Name: Book 15

text: With trains running frequently in both directions at every station, this would be his most likely primary emergency escape system.
Name: Book 15

text: This system would attract the least attention and provided the most anonymous method of travel.
Name: Book 15

text: He made a mental note to drive over to the Metro station near the University to buy a pass that would allow him unhindered access to the railway.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened a large road map of the greater D.
Name: Book 15

text: Metro Area and placed it on the surface of the oversized desk.
Name: Book 15

text: The smaller Metro map followed, smoothed over the road map.
Name: Book 15

text: He would study both maps simultaneously, doing his best to orient the locations of major roads, Beltway exits and Metro stops.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't have as much time as he would like for the task, but it would be enough.
Name: Book 15

text: Before he began, he needed to make a long overdue phone call to Jess.
Name: Book 15

text: He had left a brief message on her office voicemail, which outlined his need to take a last minute business trip to meet with a representative from one of Zenith Semiconductors' largest overseas clients.
Name: Book 15

text: He left few details beyond that.
Name: Book 15

text: The less she knew the better.
Name: Book 15

text: Still, he needed to contact her soon.

text: The hotel's decor was modernistic.

text: Shiny off-white marble floors contrasted with dark, mahogany walls, which were sporadically adorned with bright impressionist art.
Name: Book 15

Name: Book 15

text: He was dressed in a simple, business casual outfit that wouldn't have garnered a second glance in the Capitol, or any street in America: dark leather shoes, wheat brown pleated pants, and a blue oxford shirt covered by a lightweight, dark blue golfing jacket.

text: The black duffel bag in his right hand was the only part of his outfit that might warrant a second pass from a security guard or police officer, but he didn't have to worry about that here.

text: He didn't expect anyone to have found him at this point, but there was no reason to let his guard down.

text: Even if he was completely safe for the moment, treating the situation as extremely hazardous would help him transition back into the mindset that had been drilled into him for close to four years in the Black Flag training program.
Name: Book 15

text: Although it still felt like second nature to him, he accepted the reality that his skills and capabilities had degraded over the six years since he escaped Serbia.

text: He still kept in top physical condition, practiced martial arts, and maintained his marksmanship skills, but nothing could replace continuously sharpening all of these skills in an environment where the slightest advantage gained over an adversary or situation could spell the difference between life and death.

text: Two years in Serbia had sharpened these skills to perfection, and although his current skill level remained at a fraction of his previous level, it would still stack up heavily against any adversary Sanderson might throw at him.

text: When the police scanner nestled into one of the Suburban's center console drink holders crackled to life, he quickly turned his head toward the man with the cart.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't have much time to process his mistake.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel gripped a silenced pistol in each hand and rapidly turned away from the shopping cart, extending both weapons at the driver's side of the Suburban's windshield.
Name: Book 15

text: He registered the look of surprise on the man's face and alternated trigger pulls.
Name: Book 15

text: The first two bullets struck the safety glass a few inches apart, right where he saw the driver's upper torso and head, followed by another closely grouped pair just below the first.
Name: Book 15

text: The entire front windshield transformed into an opaque, blue-tinted mosaic of tightly packed glass particles, as the safety glass shattered, but held in place.
Name: Book 15

text: With his view obscured by the safety glass, Daniel walked slowly toward the vehicle, concentrating the pistol fire on the milky white glass surrounding the driver's seat.
Name: Book 15

text: Bullets ripped through the windshield, tearing into the upper dashboard and the driver beyond, confirmed by bright red splotches on the broken glass.
Name: Book 15

text: A few bullets hit the metal frame of the Suburban, causing the only noise that might attract anyone's attention in the parking lot.
Name: Book 15

text: He approached the driver's door, still firing methodically, as the door window's red-stained glass particles fell to the parking lot surface, directly exposing the driver to Daniel's deadly aim.
Name: Book 15

text: He reached the door and fired at point- blank range into the driver's head, having noticed the man's bulletproof tactical vest at the outset of the engagement.
Name: Book 15

text: He considered firing the remaining rounds into the back seat, but decided to keep some ammunition in the pistols for immediate use.
Name: Book 15

text: He had only seen one silhouette in the vehicle on his approach, which led him to believe they'd left the guy from the hotel courtyard behind in their haste to follow his car, but he might be wrong.
Name: Book 15

text: Glancing around the parking lot, he didn't see any unwanted attention directed at the Suburban and didn't detect anyone lurking nearby.
Name: Book 15

text: Deciding he was temporarily safe, he yanked open the rear passenger door of the running Suburban.
Name: Book 15

text: The interior of the truck resembled a slaughterhouse.
Name: Book 15

text: A small armory of gear sat covered in blood and skull fragments on the rear passenger seat.
Name: Book 15

text: He spotted a laptop computer protruding from the gear, which piqued his interest, so he closed the door and ran around to the other side.

text: He was greeted by a thick red-speckled stain covering the door's window.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened the door and didn't waste any time helping himself to the contents of the truck.
Name: Book 15

text: He tossed the two smoking pistols onto the floor and reached for the fully modified M-4 assault rifle leaned against the back of the seat.

text: He swung the rifle over his shoulder, using the tactical sling to secure the rifle in place over his right shoulder.

text: The rifle was slippery to the touch, covered in thick, fresh blood.

text: He started to grab the tactical vest, but decided against wearing the blood and brain showered black nylon contraption.

text: He might need to travel on foot sooner than he expected, and the last thing he would need on the streets was more bloodstains to attract attention.

text: He shoved the heavy vest to the middle of the long bench seat, uncovering the partially hidden laptop.

text: He took this into his left hand and was pulling it out of the SUV when he quickly noticed that it was attached by a USB cable to a large digital camera that almost toppled out onto the parking lot pavement.
Name: Book 15

text: He scooped the camera into his left hand, along with the laptop, and slammed the door shut.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened the front passenger door and stood up on the Suburban's side steps to look over the roof at the front of the grocery store.
Name: Book 15

text: He saw two people in the parking lot near the exit, a woman pushing a cart away from the Suburban's aisle and a tall man carrying a single grocery bag headed in his direction.
Name: Book 15

text: He also heard a car alarm chirp from somewhere behind the Suburban, which shouldn't be an issue, since anyone in that row wouldn't have an angle to see the truck's damage.
Name: Book 15

text: He ducked into the front passenger seat and sifted through the gear piled on the seat.
Name: Book 15

text: He took the tactical vest first, checking for blood and only finding a small dime-sized splatter.

text: He noticed that the vest contained ammunition magazines for the M-4 and for what he assumed to be a submachine gun.

text: The magazines were too long and thick for a pistol.

text: Daniel dug around in the front passenger foot well until he found the silenced MP-9 jammed up against the center console.

text: He considered leaving the M-4 rifle for the smaller, more concealable submachine gun, but the heavy screeching of tires nearby put any thoughts of ditching the rifle on temporary hold.

text: Juggling the rifle and gear, he donned the vest and slung the MP-9 SMG over his left shoulder.

text: He reached back into the truck and grabbed the police scanner, which squawked excitedly.

text: It was about to get very busy in this parking lot.

text: With all of the gear in place, he sprinted toward his car, which was located several parking spaces toward the store entrance.

text: He could hear a power truck engine roaring somewhere near the back of the lot.

text: A few cars down the aisle, he passed the tall man, who turned his attention from the bullet- riddled Suburban to Daniel and muttered a prayer before backing up against the hood of a white minivan.

text: Another tire squeal reinforced the urgency of his situation, as he reached the driver's door and pulled it open.

text: Distant sirens competed with the radio transmissions for a few seconds, until he heard the unmistakable drumming of the Suburban's engine, throttling at high speed down Mayfair toward the same turn Daniel had taken seconds ago.

text: As the Suburban barreled past, he raked the side exposed to him with automatic fire.

text: The truck's back end lifted a few feet off the grass and slammed back down.

text: Daniel reloaded the rifle with a spare magazine from his vest and approached the back of the truck, crouching low to present a small silhouette to anyone still capable of a fight.

text: He heard a few murmurs from further down the street and decided that he shouldn't stick around for a block party.

text: Daniel saw the front door to the house across the street open.

text: * Chapter Twenty-Eight Chapter Twenty-Eight{{{1 ### Chapter Twenty-Eight.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Justin Edwards felt like a second-class citizen.
Name: Book 15

text: He sat in the front passenger seat of a rented Chevy Impala, parked deep inside the Longfellow Elementary School parking lot and hidden from the light traffic on Stevens Avenue.
Name: Book 15

text: Underneath his navy blue, nylon FBI parka, he wore a stripped- down tactical vest loaned to him by the Portland Police Department.
Name: Book 15

text: His service pistol, a boxy Glock 23, was jammed uncomfortably between his waist and seat, causing him to continuously squirm and fidget, like a child on a long car trip.
Name: Book 15

text: This Impala, supposedly the best car available on the FBI's budget, smelled like stale cigarette smoke and cherry air freshener.
Name: Book 15

text: The car's windows had been open since they drove it off the rental lot at the Portland Jetport, but the nasty odor continued to permeate the car, and his lungs itched.
Name: Book 15

text: Nearly a dozen police vehicles crowded the southern corner of the lot, casting long shadows across the parking lot from the orange security light glowing over the gymnasium entrance doors.
Name: Book 15

text: Five black and white Suburbans formed a row, extending from an industrial dumpster near the kitchen delivery dock to the edge of the ancient, three-story school, positioned for a quick exit onto Stevens Avenue toward their target.
Name: Book 15

text: Several fully equipped SWAT officers stood in a loose circle around the second SUV in line, and he could see at least a dozen more heavily armed officers scattered throughout the rest of the vehicles.
Name: Book 15

text: The other cars were unmarked sedans, like Edward's car, filled with at least twenty additional plain-clothed and uniformed law enforcement officers.
Name: Book 15

text: They had arrived at the parking lot two hours earlier through a back entrance to the lot and waited while the sun disappeared below the trees.
Name: Book 15

text: He was accustomed to long, boring stakeouts, but the situation was different in this parking lot, and he detested the dynamic that had developed.
Name: Book 15

text: Every time he approached the SWAT huddle up near the half dozen Portland Police Department SUVs, he got cold looks from the heavily armed, black-clad men.
Name: Book 15

text: So he sat back with the rest of the FBI team, crammed into a crappy, American-made sedan that he wouldn't be caught dead in on the weekend.
Name: Book 15

text: At least he wasn't in the minivan with the forensics equipment and the real geeks.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the younger agents, whose name he didn't care enough to remember, suggested that the minivan should be his command post.
Name: Book 15

text: He just shook his head at the kid.
Name: Book 15

text: Technically, Justin Edwards was in charge of this entire operation.
Name: Book 15

text: The investigation fell under federal jurisdiction, and he was the senior agent on scene.
Name: Book 15

text: Unfortunately, the FBI had no organic assets in Maine or New Hampshire, and nobody cared enough to send Boston SWAT assets up Interstate 95 to give him some semblance of authority here.
Name: Book 15

text: Instead, he had been forced to grovel with the Portland Police Department to assemble their SWAT team for the takedown at 18 Lawn Avenue.
Name: Book 15

text: After placing an uncomfortable call to FBI headquarters, right in front of Edwards, the Portland Police liaison officer got the ball rolling for him.
Name: Book 15

text: Within an hour, he had Portland and Maine State Police SWAT teams at his disposal.
Name: Book 15

text: He briefed the teams about the threat level and rules of engagement (ROE), and that was when he lost control of the operation.
Name: Book 15

text: Once the SWAT teams had their target and ROE, it became frustratingly clear to Edwards that they didn't need or want his input.
Name: Book 15

text: They started planning the operation and scouting the location without seeking his input, or keeping him informed.
Name: Book 15

text: He knew they had a few cars on Lawn Avenue, keeping an eye on the house, but beyond that, he didn't know very much about their planned raid.
Name: Book 15

text: At this point, Special Agent Edwards had been relegated to relaying information from headquarters, and several times over the past few hours, he would reluctantly get out of the car to let them know that the other teams were still assembling.
Name: Book 15

text: They never said it, but he could read their faces, which said, "Why don't you stay in the car until you have something useful to tell us.
Name: Book 15

text: Edwards stretched his body in the car, purposefully hitting the driver, Special Agent Derek Ravenell, jarring the agent out of a light sleep.
Name: Book 15

text: He had worked with Ravenell on a few bank robbery cases in Boston and found him to be competent, but more importantly, obedient.
Name: Book 15

text: He understood the importance of the rank structure and the subtleties of loyalty, although the look he flashed Edwards didn't exactly comport with this assessment.
Name: Book 15

text: You don't see those guys napping out here," Edwards said, examining the agents in the back seat.
Name: Book 15

text: Of course, Special Agent Olson had assigned him the ugliest female special agent on the East Coast, Special Agent Sara Velasquez, after his efforts to wrangle the chick from Counterterror fell flat.
Name: Book 15

text: So, now he had the dream team sitting in his car.
Name: Book 15

text: A black driver, an ugly Latina, and Paul Adams, who was about as exciting as his name.
Name: Book 15

text: No wonder the SWAT guys wouldn't deal with him.
Name: Book 15

text: He didn't say a word to the agents in the back of the car, who both nodded apathetically.
Name: Book 15

text: Edwards' cell phone mercifully rang and delivered some good news.
Name: Book 15

text: He listened intently and acknowledged the call from Task Force HYDRA's operations center.
Name: Book 15

text: He turned around and nearly yelled into the back seat, startling Velasquez and Adams.
Name: Book 15

text: We hit the house at 2100 hours," he squawked excitedly and jumped out of the car, yelling the same words at the SWAT teams as he rushed across the parking lot.
Name: Book 15

text: "Douche bag," Special Agent Sara Velasquez uttered, and everyone in the car mumbled their agreement.
Name: Book 15
