text: * Chapter Thirty-Five Chapter Thirty-Five{{{1 ### Chapter Thirty-Five.
Name: Book 15

text: Interstate 95, outside of Stamford, Connecticut.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Heather Olson sat in the front passenger seat of an unmarked FBI Chevy Tahoe, carefully studying the multiple brake lights appearing ahead of them.
Name: Book 15

text: The driver, dressed in full SWAT gear, without helmet, slowed the Tahoe as Olson radioed the Connecticut state police.
Name: Book 15

text: They were entering the outer limits of Stamford, Connecticut, and traffic had been relatively light, until now.
Name: Book 15

text: They had left Boston a few minutes before seven and had avoided most traffic, only running into a slight backup on the 91 in Hartford.
Name: Book 15

text: Every time the Tahoe decelerated, Olson tensed.
Name: Book 15

text: She didn't feel comfortable transporting Munoz by car, but Sharpe thought an air transfer would be even riskier.
Name: Book 15

text: Too many predictable points of passage.
Name: Book 15

text: She didn't agree, but she kept her concerns quiet.
Name: Book 15

text: The assignment to handle Munoz was a significant opportunity for Olson, and she didn't want to sour it right at the end.
Name: Book 15

text: They had managed to break Munoz and provide headquarters with information that kept the investigation moving forward.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: It was the FBI's only win today, and she had spearheaded the entire effort with Gregory Carlisle's help.
Name: Book 15

text: His team had performed brilliantly throughout the interrogation phase, and she appreciated the opportunity to work with such an FBI legend.
Name: Book 15

text: She received word from the state police that there had been an accident just past exit ten, on the westbound side, which involved several vehicles.
Name: Book 15

text: He stated that the accident involved a few minor injuries and mostly superficial damage to the vehicles, but that the westbound lanes were closed.
Name: Book 15

text: They were diverting all traffic through off ramp, which emptied onto Ledge Road and reemerged on the other side of the accident, about a half-mile down from the exit.
Name: Book 15

text: Olson notified the state police that they were transporting a federal prisoner and requested that they clear the stretch of Ledge Road for their three-vehicle convoy.
Name: Book 15

text: The state troopers said they would stop all further traffic from exiting the highway until they arrived.
Name: Book 15

text: Olson picked up a different radio and spoke with the tactical teams in each vehicle, relaying standard operating instructions and warning them to stay vigilant.
Name: Book 15

text: Her own SUV carried three SWAT agents from the Boston field office, including the driver, and the rear SUV carried four additional SWAT agents.
Name: Book 15

text: The prisoner transport vehicle, a windowless Ford Econoline van on loan from the Suffolk County Sheriff's Department, carried a mix of six FBI and Suffolk County Sheriff's Department SWAT personnel and a Suffolk County driver.
Name: Book 15

text: They had sufficient firepower to repel any attempt to free Munoz, but what she feared most was an assassination attempt.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz had blown the lid on a major clandestine operation involving some nasty people, and a retribution strike was highly likely.
Name: Book 15

text: They would be defenseless against an improvised explosive device, or any similar massive attempt to destroy one of their vehicles.
Name: Book 15

text: None of the trucks were armored.
Name: Book 15

text: The vehicles tightened their column formation, activated their blue strobe lights, and veered onto the shoulder of the road, speeding past the slowing traffic.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Olson could see the state trooper's red and blue strobes in the distance, which meant she had a clear shot at reaching the exit.
Name: Book 15

text: She told the driver to accelerate.
Name: Book 15

text: They arrived at the top of the exit, and the state troopers executed their plan flawlessly.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the two police cars moved to block the exit, and the other moved far enough into the exit roadway to allow the FBI convoy to roll past.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: The strobe lights bathed the Tahoe's interior as they rumbled through the gravel past the two police cars.
Name: Book 15

text: The road ahead of them was not empty, and Olson became annoyed.
Name: Book 15

text: She had specifically requested that the road be emptied of all civilian traffic, but she could see several cars stopped at an intersection below the Interstate overpass.
Name: Book 15

text: Her dashboard mounted GPS receiver indicated that this was Noroton Avenue, and for some reason, the police officers in the intersection were letting traffic onto their road, flowing in the opposite direction.
Name: Book 15

text: Olson radioed the state police as their convoy slowed to an uncomfortable stop next to a busy diner parking lot, and the cars in front of them attempted to move to the side of the road.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Olson could tell that they wouldn't have enough room to maneuver down the middle of the one-lane road, unless the oncoming traffic was stopped.
Name: Book 15

text: She counted several cars, until she received word that the officers at the intersection were halting all Noroton Avenue traffic.
Name: Book 15

text: Once the last car passed them, they pulled around the line of cars and sped toward the intersection.
Name: Book 15

text: Nobody in the van or the lead SUV noticed that the rear SUV failed to follow them.
Name: Book 15

text: As they sped past Noroton Avenue onto the highway ramp, Olson could see the highway lights emerge beyond the road ahead.
Name: Book 15

text: She started to loosen up and took a deep breath.
Name: Book 15

text: What she heard next nearly sent her into cardiac arrest.
Name: Book 15

text: Her intra-vehicle radio crackled to life.
Name: Book 15

text: "I've lost the rear van.
Name: Book 15

text: Stop the van," she ordered, drawing her pistol from a hip holster jammed up against the door.
Name: Book 15

text: A second later, she heard someone in the back seat say, "Oh shit," right before the front of their Tahoe was T-boned from the left by a gigantic pickup truck, grinding both vehicles to a halt in the middle of the on-ramp.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Olson's head and pistol slammed against the passenger window, shattering the glass.
Name: Book 15

text: The prisoner van barely screeched to a stop just behind the tangled heap of American-built trucks.
Name: Book 15

text: Shadowy figures emerged from the tree line several meters away to the right, wearing gas masks and carrying assault weapons.
Name: Book 15

text: They broke up into two teams of three, each team carrying a large metal canister connected to portable compression gear.
Name: Book 15

text: They nestled in low on each of the convoy vehicles.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz sat facing two SWAT agents in the middle of the van.
Name: Book 15

text: The transport van was an aging ten-passenger Econoline monster, reconfigured for correctional system use.
Name: Book 15

text: The first two rows of seating faced each other, so a sheriff, or in this case, two SWAT officers, could accompany prisoners.
Name: Book 15

text: The third row behind Munoz was occupied by two more heavily breathing SWAT guys, one of whom kept jamming his knee into Munoz's back.
Name: Book 15

text: He was secured by his ankles and wrists to the solid metal structure buried underneath the seat's thin plastic cushioning and couldn't budge.
Name: Book 15

text: A metal cage wall separated the driver and another black-clad commando from the transport compartment.
Name: Book 15

text: All of the rear windows were tinted and covered with a thick metal screen, and the passengers had to enter from the rear doors, which represented a tactical disadvantage if the van was attacked.
Name: Book 15

text: The van's sliding doors had been welded shut for security, and he didn't think the agents could effectively shoot out of the side windows.
Name: Book 15

text: Overall, he assessed the vehicle as low security.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd escaped from much more difficult situations, under much worse conditions, but that wasn't his job today.
Name: Book 15

text: He'd already accomplished his mission, and would, for the first time in his career, let himself be rescued.
Name: Book 15

text: The van came to a sudden unexpected stop; he took a deep breath and held it.
Name: Book 15

text: Panic overtook the van.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the SWAT agents jammed Munoz's head down, and the officers scrambled to take positions covering three hundred and sixty degrees.
Name: Book 15

text: A high-pitched mechanical drilling sound filled the van, and someone screamed, "Back us the fuck out of here now.
Name: Book 15

text: "Does anyone have anything.
Name: Book 15

text: yelled the SWAT agent in the front passenger seat.
Name: Book 15

text: "Contact right side, low.
Name: Book 15

text: one of the agents screamed.
Name: Book 15

text: With his head jammed down, he saw two holes penetrate the lower right side of the van compartment.
Name: Book 15

text: One second later, compressed air instantly filled the van with a cloudy vapor, and he felt the hand pressing down on his head ease up a little.
Name: Book 15

text: He continued to hold his breath, and the hand completely slackened, replaced by 250 pounds of body weight and tactical gear.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz lost some of his breath, but managed to roll the agent onto the floor.
Name: Book 15

text: He sat upright and glanced around at the slumped figures filling the van.
Name: Book 15

text: A small explosive charge rocked the back of the van, and two armed men wearing gas masks pulled the door open and hopped in.
Name: Book 15

text: One of them had to yank a slumbering FBI agent down out of the van, so they could proceed through the opening between the benches and the side.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz's lungs burned as he tried to hold his breath long enough to receive the empty mask in one of the men's hands.
Name: Book 15

text: The mask was pushed over his face, and he felt a cool rush of air as the man gave him a thumbs up sign right in front of the eye piece.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz took a shallow breath of fresh air, then gulped massive breaths while the team worked on freeing him from the van.
Name: Book 15

text: He had held his breath for over a minute, something he had practiced for several weeks.
Name: Book 15

text: The men ditched all of their gear in place, except for the weapons, and took off toward the highway.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz sprinted with the men past the wrecked trucks, as three slightly-damaged SUVs rolled across the flat grass and met them halfway to the top of the on-ramp.
Name: Book 15

text: The vehicles were full when they sped away down Interstate 95 toward Stamford.
Name: Book 15

text: Five minutes later, they had just exited the Interstate at East Putnam Road, close to seven miles down the highway, when the police scanner exploded with activity.
Name: Book 15

text: Fifteen minutes after that, they were speeding through Cos Cob Harbor on two powerful cruising boats, just a few buoy markers away from emptying into the Long Island Sound.
Name: Book 15

text: * Chapter Thirty-Six Chapter Thirty-Six{{{1 ### Chapter Thirty-Six.
Name: Book 15

text: FBI Headquarters, Washington, D.
Name: Book 15

text: Special Agent Sharpe examined the contents of the sealed folder at a workstation borrowed from Special Agent Weber's communications team.
Name: Book 15

text: The fax contained two sheets of paper, which gave them sparse, additional information regarding Petrovich and Munoz.
Name: Book 15

text: The second page ended abruptly, stopping in the middle of a sentence:.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz not assigned to permanent undercover operation in Central/South America.
Name: Book 15

text: His specialty skill utilized for focused penetration of drug cartel detainees.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe stared at the last sentence, but without the rest of the words, the implication of Munoz's talent didn't sink in.
Name: Book 15

text: The third page of the fax lay on the floor of the Sanctum, in the middle of a massive, thickening pool of blood.
Name: Book 15

text: It was barely readable at this point, but the information contained in the single remaining paragraph contained on the page would have raised an immediate alarm for Sharpe.
Name: Book 15

text: Munoz had been trained to extract information from prisoners by posing as one, in most cases without indigenous law enforcement collusion or knowledge.
Name: Book 15

text: "Weber, this fax is incomplete.
Name: Book 15

text: Would you request the third page for me.
Name: Book 15

text: "Not a problem, sir.
Name: Book 15

text: We have a full team on duty in the communications hub," Weber replied, reaching for a phone.
Name: Book 15

text: The agent stopped and looked up at Sharpe.
Name: Book 15

text: "You've been here for over thirty-six hours at this point and look like death warmed over.
Name: Book 15

text: I think you've earned a little break.
Name: Book 15

text: Things will settle down tonight, but we'll need to be focused again tomorrow.
Name: Book 15

text: Why don't you head out and report back at zero four thirty," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: How about I grab one of the couches in the comms lounge.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll make sure everyone here has my cell.
Name: Book 15

text: I appreciate itI'm about to fall over," Weber said.
Name: Book 15

text: "You look like it.
Name: Book 15

text: Request the rest of the fax, and go get some rest.
Name: Book 15

text: We'll see you in the morning, and I know where to find you.
Name: Book 15

text: Thanks for the hard work today, Weber.
Name: Book 15

text: I appreciate it," Sharpe said and signaled for Agent O'Reilly to join him.
Name: Book 15

text: The two agents walked back to Sharpe's office, where Mendoza was waiting.
Name: Book 15

text: Instead of the institutional fluorescent overhead lighting common throughout the building, Sharpe's office was softly lit by two standing floor lamps and a green banker's lamp on his desk.
Name: Book 15

text: At this juncture in his career, Sharpe was accustomed to late nights and took efforts to make the time as comfortable as possible.
Name: Book 15

text: Mendoza sat in Sharpe's usual late night working spot, a custom leather armchair illuminated by one of the standing lamps.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe appreciated Mendoza's ability to make himself feel comfortable in any surrounding.
Name: Book 15

text: Mendoza always seemed laid back and at ease, even under duress.
Name: Book 15

text: It was one of the key traits that convinced Sharpe to ask Mendoza to postpone his next assignment, a promotional move to Investigations, until Task Force HYDRA finished the next phase in its anticipated life cycle.
Name: Book 15

text: His prospective supervisor within Investigations signed off on the delay, and Mendoza appeared more than happy to stay on for another six months, especially since they were making such rapid gains unraveling Al Qaeda's U.
Name: Book 15

text: -based financial support network.
Name: Book 15

text: He expected Mendoza to appear deflated at some point during the day, as the bad news piled onto them, but the man either kept it to himself, or truly remained unshaken.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe admired either possibility, considering what could be at stake for both of their careers.
Name: Book 15

text: Mendoza got up from the chair, with an open file in his hands.
Name: Book 15

text: "Don't get up for me, Frank.
Name: Book 15

text: Seriously, we all need some time in that chair today.
Name: Book 15

text: Plus, I guarantee I'll just have to get up and answer that phone as soon as my ass is firmly planted.
Name: Book 15

text: Dana, grab any seat, just don't steal Frank's.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe moved around to his government-supplied desk chair as Mendoza sank back into the leather chair.
Name: Book 15

text: "Dana's CIS papers are on your desk.
Name: Book 15

text: She just needs to sign on the highlighted lines," Mendoza said, and Agent O'Reilly stopped her descent into one of the office chairs to the left of Sharpe's desk.
Name: Book 15

text: "Take a few minutes to review the agreement, and sign your life away.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't mean to insult your intelligence, but I just want to make sure you understand the importance of this agreement.
Name: Book 15

text: You can only discuss CIS Category One information with myself, Agent Mendoza and the CIA liaison, Randy Keller.
Name: Book 15

text: At this point, these are the only people that aren't locked in a room at the Pentagon with the Black Flag files," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: To bring you up to speed in under thirty secondsthe list of names you've worked on all day belong to a group of operatives trained under a clandestine program called Black Flag.
Name: Book 15

text: It no longer exists, having been shut down by Congress and buried by the Pentagon for several years.
Name: Book 15

text: However, as you saw today, someone reactivated former members of this group to assassinate every one of this task force's Al Qaeda financing suspects.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't need to reinforce the fact that the task force's investigation was effectively destroyed today.
Name: Book 15

text: "At this point, we are simply trying to figure out why they were assassinated.
Name: Book 15

text: Is this a rogue anti-terrorist-focused group taking their own fight to Al Qaeda.
Name: Book 15

text: Is this sponsored by Al Qaeda.
Name: Book 15

text: Did they discover that we were close to fully unraveling their financial network.
Name: Book 15

text: Is this the prelude to another major attack, and they're just cleaning up any loose ends.
Name: Book 15

text: I'm having a hard time believing that this group is working for Al Qaeda, but maybe the individual operatives don't ask questions, and their leader, General Terrence Sanderson, took a huge payoff to mislead them.
Name: Book 15

text: That's a familiar name," O'Reilly said, signing the paperwork without reading it.
Name: Book 15

text: "Yeah, a few years ago, he was all over the news.
Name: Book 15

text: He retired under suspicious circumstances that were never fully disclosed.
Name: Book 15

text: Now we know why.
Name: Book 15

text: I can't stress the importance of information security in this case.
Name: Book 15

text: This is a guaranteed prison sentence for screwing up.
Name: Book 15

text: You'll continue working in the operations center, but one of us will need to approve any work you are conducting, just to make sure it's not a CIS One spin off.
Name: Book 15

text: All discussions of the restricted material need to take place in person and away from other personnel.
Name: Book 15

text: Are you good with this.
Name: Book 15

text: I assume the INTERPOL digging probably falls under CIS One.
Name: Book 15

text: "Yes, and you conducted the search after signing these papers.
Name: Book 15

text: "Of course," O'Reilly said.
Name: Book 15

text: "So, this information sheds some light on Petrovich, and all of the Black Flag operatives," Sharpe said, handing the newest Sanctum information to Agent Mendoza.
Name: Book 15

text: "I'm not at all surprised he was able to do so much damage up in Silver Spring.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich's assigned area of operation was Serbia, and he spent two years operating there, starting in early '97 and ending at some point in '99.
Name: Book 15

text: "His military service record indicates an honorable discharge in September '99," Mendoza added.
Name: Book 15

text: So this was his last tour of duty, so to speak.
Name: Book 15

text: Prior to that, he received training in all of the areas listed on our first fax, with a specialty focus in skills.
Name: Book 15

text: Sniper operations, urban combat survival, and oddly enough, computer networking/security," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "That's odd, especially for Serbia," O'Reilly commented.
Name: Book 15

text: "Why do you say that.
Name: Book 15

text: "Well, I can't imagine a need for that skill, especially in that region in the late nineties.
Name: Book 15

text: There was barely a need for it here.
Name: Book 15

text: I mean, the systems were still pretty basic in the U.
Name: Book 15

text: at that point.
Name: Book 15

text: But in war-torn Serbia.
Name: Book 15

text: Does the sheet mention the specifics of his assignment there.
Name: Book 15

text: "His job was to penetrate one of the ultra-nationalist paramilitary groups," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "The Pentagon didn't feel the need to convey that information," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: Well, whatever he did, or still does, he's highly dangerous.
Name: Book 15

text: He murdered a cop without hesitation and killed six ex-special forces guys with ease".
Name: Book 15

text: Mendoza said, whose comment was interrupted by Sharpe's desk phone.
Name: Book 15

text: "Hold that thought," Sharpe said and picked up the handset, "Special Agent Ryan Sharpe.
Name: Book 15

text: No luck getting through to the Sanctum.
Name: Book 15

text: The line appears to be dead.
Name: Book 15

text: I called Pentagon security and asked them to notify whoever was in charge of the Sanctum that the line was busted.
Name: Book 15

text: Now get some rest," Sharpe said, then hung up the phone and turned back to the others.
Name: Book 15

text: "Some snafu over at the Pentagon.
Name: Book 15

text: What have we come up with for Petrovich.
Name: Book 15

text: "Agent O'Reilly put together a chronology with details.
Name: Book 15

text: Here's the short version: born and raised in Crystal Lake, Illinois, by parents who are still living in that town.
Name: Book 15

text: No brothers or sisters.
Name: Book 15

text: Went to undergrad at Northwestern, not too far away in Evanston, Illinois, right on Lake Michigan.
Name: Book 15

text: Graduated in '91 with a degree in economics/finance and received a commission as a naval officer through the NROTC program at Northwestern.
Name: Book 15

text: Minored in Russian language.
Name: Book 15

text: He attended the Surface Warfare School in Coronado, California, during the summer of '91 and reported to a frigate stationed in Japan later that year.
Name: Book 15

text: Transferred to Naval Post Graduate School in Monterey in '93".
Name: Book 15

text: "I know a lot of former military officers, and that seems pretty quick to go from ship to shore.
Name: Book 15

text: As a marine officer, you do two tours, roughly two years each, then a B Billet, the navy's equivalent to a shore tour.
Name: Book 15

text: It's pretty standard across the board from service to service.
Name: Book 15

text: Post-grad school would definitely be a post junior officer tour.
Name: Book 15

text: Not something you'd do after your first sea tourand a short sea tour at that.
Name: Book 15

text: He reported to the USS Rodney M.
Name: Book 15

text: Davis in November of '91 and left in the spring of '93.
Name: Book 15

text: That's also unusual, and it gets better.
Name: Book 15

text: After grad school, he reports to a joint command attached to NORAD.
Name: Book 15

text: How much do you want to bet nobody ever ran into him at either one of these stations.
Name: Book 15

text: Finally, in early '97 he transfers overseas to SACEUR's Maritime headquarters in London, where he stays through discharge in '99.
Name: Book 15

text: "And we all know he damn well didn't spend a minute in London.
Name: Book 15

text: Four years of training.
Name: Book 15

text: "It would appear that way.
Name: Book 15

text: That's a long training program," Mendoza said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Makes sense for an undercover operation.
Name: Book 15

text: This program must have been extremely successful," O'Reilly said.
Name: Book 15

text: "But old habits die hard, and it doesn't look like this group skipped a beat.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich is the perfect example.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't believe for one second that Petrovich was the original choice for the Maine hit.
Name: Book 15

text: They tried to recruit Steven Gedman for this operation, and he had a complete mental breakdown a few days ago.
Name: Book 15

text: Petrovich literally walked right in off the street and accomplished the mission, in a particularly nasty fashion.
Name: Book 15

text: No sniper rifles for this guy.
Name: Book 15

text: He likes using a knife and cutting off heads," Sharpe said, looking at O'Reilly while Mendoza shook his head.
Name: Book 15

text: "We have to find this guy.
Name: Book 15

text: We won't be able to play musical chairs with Munoz for much longer.
Name: Book 15

text: Keep digging through his file for anything valuable.
Name: Book 15

text: I'll have Special Agent Edwards turn up the heat on his wife".
Name: Book 15

text: O'Reilly chuckled, then apologized.
Name: Book 15

text: "You might want to be careful how you word that to Edwards.
Name: Book 15

text: He might take it literally," Mendoza said, smiling at O'Reilly.
Name: Book 15

text: "And we'll tap every phone he could think of calling, pull phone records, start staking out friends.
Name: Book 15

text: He can't leave the country at this point.
Name: Book 15

text: Every law enforcement agency in the country is looking for him," Sharpe finished.
Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe's phone rang again, and he snapped it off the receiver.
Name: Book 15

text: Why are you on the phone talking to me.
Name: Book 15

text: You should be lying down on some very uncomfortable couch right now.
Name: Book 15

text: Seriously, you need some rest," Sharpe said, and he could hear O'Reilly and Mendoza laughing.
Name: Book 15

text: "Sir, I have Special Agent Dan Bernstein on the line.
Name: Book 15

text: He's the New Haven SAC.
Name: Book 15

text: Olson's convoy got hit," Weber said, and Sharpe shot up from his chair.
Name: Book 15

text: "Put him through," he said, covering the mouthpiece.
Name: Book 15

text: "Olson's convoy was hit," he said to Mendoza and O'Reilly, who stood up from their seats and moved toward the desk.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: Sharpe heard a few clicks and then Weber's voice.
Name: Book 15

text: "You're connected, Agent Bernstein.
Name: Book 15

text: "Ryan, it's Dan Bernstein.
Name: Book 15

text: I have a situation here.
Name: Book 15

text: State troopers contacted my office and said they have three disabled vehicles filled with FBI agents off exit ten, just on the outskirts of Stamford.
Name: Book 15

text: "What about the agents.
Name: Book 15

text: The agents in the rear SUV and the van were disabled by some kind of gas.
Name: Book 15

text: One of the troopers passed out entering the van.
Name: Book 15

text: The front SUV was hit by a massive pickup truck, and the four agents inside were banged up pretty bad, but they should be fine.
Name: Book 15

text: The driver and Olson took it the worst.
Name: Book 15

text: I guess the pickups collided engine block to engine block, crunching the two of them pretty badly.
Name: Book 15

text: They're en route to the hospital now, in stable condition.
Name: Book 15

text: "I assume the prisoner is dead," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "There was no sign of a prisoner.
Name: Book 15

text: They could tell he was cut free of his restraints, but other than that, nothing.
Name: Book 15

text: State police say the whole thing was over in less than a minute," Bernstein said.
Name: Book 15

text: "Does anyone have any idea why they were off the highway.
Name: Book 15

text: "All part of the takedown.
Name: Book 15

text: State troopers had a dozen or so scraped up cars between the southbound ramps at exit 10\.
Name: Book 15

text: Minor accident about twenty minutes before the FBI arrived.
Name: Book 15

text: They were diverting traffic through the off rampand right back onto the highway on the other side of the accident.
Name: Book 15

text: Troopers said that as soon as the FBI convoy left the highway, some of the people started getting back into their vehicles.
Name: Book 15

text: They had no idea what to make of it.
Name: Book 15

text: A large pickup truck takes off, and they all hear the collision.
Name: Book 15

text: The rest of the vehicles speed over to the on ramp and take off down the interstate ten seconds later.
Name: Book 15

text: This was a highly-organized strike, Ryan, and they simply disappeared.
Name: Book 15

text: How many state troopers did they have on scene.
Name: Book 15

text: "A lot, but it happened so fast, it took them a few minutes to realize what happened.
Name: Book 15

text: They radioed ahead, but unfortunately, every state trooper on duty along that stretch of the Interstate was sitting at that accident site," Bernstein said.
Name: Book 15

text: I can't stress to you how important it is that we find this crew.
Name: Book 15

text: Even just one of them.
Name: Book 15

text: It's critical," Sharpe said.
Name: Book 15

text: "I fully understand the situation, and every law enforcement officer along the Interstate 95 corridor is looking for them.
Name: Book 15

text: So far they have nothing.
Name: Book 15

text: They also have a possible police impersonator, and this is throwing everyone for a loop.
Name: Book 15

text: Local cops at the intersection below the highway were told by a state trooper to switch radio frequencies a few minutes before the FBI convoy arrived at the off ramp.
Name: Book 15

text: They then got orders to let traffic from one of the local roads pass, effectively blocking Olson's group at the intersection.
Name: Book 15

text: The rear SUV was hit with the gas while they were stopped at the intersection.
Name: Book 15

text: , they had worked out a rough plan for the day, which was the only reason she remained in town.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel had assured her earlier that within twenty-four hours, they would vanish from the grid together and start over.
Name: Book 15

text: She trusted his assessment of the situation, and her own skills.
Name: Book 15

text: One way or the other, she could get out of Portland, even if placed in full police custody.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel called her as soon as she left work, on one of her untraceable cell phones, and convinced her that he was fine.
Name: Book 15

text: He was waiting at a Marriott Hotel for further instructions and told her to follow her regular routine.
Name: Book 15

text: She went for a run after that and spotted the police trucks behind the elementary school.
Name: Book 15

text: She added an extra mile to her run in order to give the two stakeout cars on her street the impression that she hadn't been near the elementary school.
Name: Book 15

text: She waited for what seemed like an eternity in the house, playing music and pretending to be busy.
Name: Book 15

text: The Portland Police Department's SWAT officers did an amazingly professional job moving in on the house undetected.
Name: Book 15

text: The team's sudden entry truly startled her, and she reacted instinctively, almost putting her entire plan in jeopardy.
Name: Book 15

text: Luckily for her, she had only been holding a spoon, preparing to pull a yogurt from the refrigerator.
Name: Book 15

text: A knife or fork might have resulted in a bullet to the head.
Name: Book 15

text: Agent Edwards arrived in time to break things up and keep her out of police custody, which was a blessing.
Name: Book 15

text: She could tell by his first glance at her on the floor that he would be an easy target for later.
Name: Book 15

text: She softened one of her looks in his direction, and Edwards did the rest.
Name: Book 15

text: She didn't even have to suggest they leave the house.
Name: Book 15

text: He was already forming that plan while she lay on the floor.
Name: Book 15

text: Once her job with Edwards was finished at the hotel, she grabbed the first taxi she could find and called Daniel, but the phone he had been using went to voicemail immediately.
Name: Book 15

text: She tried the next number in the sequence she had been given, and it did the same thing.
Name: Book 15

text: Her next call went to Sanderson, but he didn't answer either.
Name: Book 15

text: She tried the same combination of numbers several times on the way to Logan Airport, with the same result.
Name: Book 15

text: She wondered if it was possible that Sanderson's entire crew had been rolled up by the FBI.
Name: Book 15

text: At this point, she didn't see any option other than to proceed west on the Massachusetts Turnpike, toward West Virginia.
Name: Book 15

text: Sanderson had given her a rendezvous point where he claimed Daniel would be waiting, and they could organize their departure from the United States.
Name: Book 15

text: Sanderson promised to help them in any way possible.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel had wanted her to head south toward D.
Name: Book 15

text: , but given her complete inability to make contact with either of them, she decided to head in a safer direction.
Name: Book 15

text: She opened the trunk of the Toyota Camry and removed a black nylon gym bag, taking it into the car with her.
Name: Book 15

text: She placed it on the passenger seat and zipped it open.
Name: Book 15

text: At the top, a pistol sat under an envelope.
Name: Book 15

text: She opened it and read Daniel's note:.
Name: Book 15

text: "Sorry this caught up to us so quickly.
Name: Book 15

text: We've both been through hell and back, so this is nothing.
Name: Book 15

text: A small bump in the road.
Name: Book 15

text: If for some reason you lose contact with me for more than twenty-four hours, find Sanderson.
Name: Book 15

text: I don't completely trust him, but he will be your best option for setting up the arrangements to leave the country.
Name: Book 15

text: Sunset drinks at the Santa Isabel.
Name: Book 15

text: Love you always, Danny.
Name: Book 15

text: "Damn it," she whispered and leaned her head back against the headrest.
Name: Book 15

text: Jessica took a moment to clear her head, which didn't work.
Name: Book 15

text: Her thoughts kept returning to their house and the pictures.
Name: Book 15

text: She had to walk around the house for hours and wait for the inevitable, staring at the memories she couldn't take with her.
Name: Book 15

text: This was almost more than she could endure, and she considered putting together a package to mailsomewhere.
Name: Book 15

text: She didn't know where, but she wanted to save something.
Name: Book 15

text: Daniel had warned her against doing this, and he had been right.
Name: Book 15

text: Anything she did could have tipped off the police or FBIthough she doubted Edwards would have figured it out.
Name: Book 15

text: She could have pulled a small framed picture out of her purse in the hotel room, and he wouldn't have put it together.
Name: Book 15

text: His mind had strayed about as far as possible from the investigation at that point.
Name: Book 15

text: She wondered if they'd ever be safe in one place again.
Name: Book 15

text: Maybe it didn't matter.
Name: Book 15

text: Maybe it was a ridiculous dream to invest so much energy into creating a "normal" life.
Name: Book 15

text: Nothing about either of them was normal, and this next time around, they wouldn't fall into the same mental trap.
Name: Book 15

text: Still, a deep part of her yearned for everything in that house, and it comforted her in a way.
Name: Book 15

text: It reminded her that she hadn't been completely ruined.
Name: Book 15

text: She folded the letter and stuffed it between the bag and the back of the seat.
Name: Book 15

text: She removed the pistol, with suppressor already attached, and pulled the slide back far enough to check the chamber.
Name: Book 15

text: She saw the brief reflection of brass and could tell that Danny had left the gun ready for immediate use.
Name: Book 15

text: She tucked the pistol under the driver's seat for quick access, hoping she would never have to use it.
Name: Book 15

text: She preferred the cold, razor-sharp blade of a knife, if circumstances allowed.
Name: Book 15

text: She had taken to edged weapon training at The Farm like it was second nature, eventually pushing the CIA's best instructors to their limits.
Name: Book 15

text: Reaching into the bag again, she found several large Ziploc bags, each filled with a different style wig.
Name: Book 15

text: She pushed through the bags, selecting a medium- length red one.
Name: Book 15

text: Using the rearview mirror to adjust the hairpiece, she tied her own hair down in several tight knots and made a sudden transformation from black to dark red hair.
Name: Book 15

text: A kit containing various contact lenses completed the one-minute change.
Name: Book 15

text: Now she had red hair and green eyes.
Name: Book 15

text: Once she located a suitable bathroom, she'd change clothing and get rid of Agent D'Angelo's hideous running shoes.
Name: Book 15

text: She had a lot of things to ditch along the way, including all of her current identification and credit cards.
Name: Book 15

text: She felt around for the other object that would have to go, according to standard procedure.
Name: Book 15

text: She wasn't sure if Daniel had already taken care of it for her and started to give up searching through the bag, until her hand bumped up against the familiar nylon scabbard.
Name: Book 15

text: She pulled the Gerber commando knife out of the bag and stared at it for a moment.
Name: Book 15

text: Less than thirty-six hours ago, this knife had sealed their involvement in Sanderson's plan.
Name: Book 15

text: She promised herself that if the general had double-crossed them, she would plunge the same knife deep into his neck.
Name: Book 15

text: Satisfied that everything was ready, she started the car, bracing herself for a long drive.
Name: Book 15

text: She wanted to get out of Massachusetts by sunrise.
Name: Book 15

text: More importantly, she needed to put as much distance behind her as possible.
Name: Book 15

text: She was used to running and didn't have any expectation that this aspect of her life would ever change.
Name: Book 15

text: At least she had someone to run with.
Name: Book 15

Name: Book 15

text: Justin Edwards' head pounded, and his mouth stuck together, completely lacking any recent, significant saliva production.
Name: Book 15

text: He could barely separate his caked- together lips.
Name: Book 15

text: His face felt a little numb, like he was drunk, but beyond this slight anesthesia, his entire body ached.

text: What the fuck had happened.
Name: Book 15

text: He lifted his eyelids, but the effort required to keep them open was a near Herculean task for him, so he squinted for a few seconds, then closed them.
Name: Book 15

text: He lay on his back, not wanting to turn his head, but he didn't recognize the room during the brief eyeball reconnaissance.
Name: Book 15

text: He could tell it was a hotel, but his mind couldn't process any facts or data related to his presence in this room.
Name: Book 15

text: He opened his eyes a little further and could see the green glass of a wine bottle on the desk out of the corner of his eye.

text: He managed to move his head far enough to examine the bottle through his hazy vision, evoking a splitting migraine.

text: He could see two empty wine glasses on the desk next to the bottle, one stained around the rim with lipstick.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 15

text: No sign of the suspect.

text: Agent Edwards, are you all right.
